desc: 职位来源于智联招聘。  职位描述 / Responsibilities： Create and compile specification according to customer requirement. 根据客户需求,拟定和编译规格. Conduct evaluation and feasibility studies based on requirements. 针对需求, 进行评估和可行性研究. Design, develop and modify software applications based on specifications. 根据规格,设计,开发以及修改应用软件. Test and qualify developed applications. 测试及验证开发的应用程序. Provide software support to internal and external customer. 为内部和外部客户提供软件支援. Troubleshoot software problems remote or onsite and provide solutions. 探讨软件问题(包含远距支援),并提供解决方案. Provide professional training to internal and external customer. 为内部和外部客户提供专业培训.  职位要求 / Profile： Degree in the field of computer science, electrical engineering, automation technology or practical experience in the field of software development. 计算机科学、电气工程、自动化技术本科及以上学历或软件开发实践经验. Very good knowledge in development with C++ / C# 熟练编译语言: C++ / C# . Knowledge in databases (MS-SQL, MySQL, etc. ) 掌握数据库(MS-SQL, MySQL, 其他 ) . Good knowledge in processing of various data formats (XML, etc.) 良好掌握各种文件格式的处理(XML, 其他). Good command of English language. 拥有良好英语水平. Possess good written and verbal communication skills. 拥有良好的书写及言语沟通技巧. It is especially good to have a background on the device 有设备背景尤佳. Independent, hardworking and possess the right initiative. Ability to work under pressure. 独立,勤奋并积极主动. 拥有在压力下工作的能力. Willingness to travel both domestic and abroad. 愿意在国内外出差.  以担保或任何理由索要财物，扣押证照，均涉嫌违法。

Passionné(e) par la blockchain, les crypto-actifs et la finance décentralisée et envie d’être pionnier(e) du Web3 ? Rejoins l’équipe Crypto et Blockchain, au sein de l’entité Data Science de Sia Partners !  Nos clients, de grands groupes comme des start-ups, sont à la recherche de nouveaux business models via les technologies de rupture comme la blockchain et les crypto-actifs. Ainsi, nous les accompagnons de bout en bout dans leurs projets.  Voici quelques exemples de réalisations :  Plateformes de tokenisation d’actifs  Société de minage de crypto-actifs  Plateforme décentralisée d’inclusion financière  Crypto-banque  Benchmarks et analyses techniques   Déploiement de notre solution de traçabilité Stratumn  En tant que consultant, tu accompagneras nos clients sur les sujets suivants :  Accompagnement stratégique (définition de business model, analyse de compétitivité)  Cadrage de projet  Analyse technique  Réalisation de projets sur blockchains publiques et privées  Chez Sia Partners les activités internes ont une importance toute particulière, dans ce cadre ta contribution s’articulera autour des axes suivants :  Conduite de travaux de recherche et développement en interne  Rédaction d’études et d’articles techniques  Intervention lors d’évènements de type conférences, petits déjeuners, meet-ups  Mise en place de formations internes et externes, en présentiel ou en ligne  Développement commercial    Qualifications  Les pré-requis :  Tu es diplômé(e) d’une grande école d'ingénieur, université ou école de management  Tu possèdes idéalement une expérience réussie d’au moins 3 à 5 ans dans le conseil  Tu possède une expérience dans le secteur de la blockchain et des crypto-actifs  Tu es passionné(e) par l’écosystème crypto-actifs (cryptomonnaies, DeFi, le web3, etc...)  Tu as une bonne connaissance des blockchains publiques (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Avalanche, Solana...)  Tu as une bonne connaissance des blockchains privées (Hyperledger Fabric, Corda...)  Tu es autonome dans la réalisation de propositions commerciales  Français  Anglais courant indispensable   Les plus :  Une connaissance du secteur financier    Informations supplémentaires  Ce que nous offrons :  Un salaire compétitif   Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale à croissance rapide  Capacité à travailler sur des missions internationales  Travailler chez un client, en télé-travail et dans notre bureau au 21 rue de Berri  Sia Partners est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Tous les aspects de l’emploi, tels que le recrutement, les promotions, la rémunération, ou les sanctions sont basés uniquement sur les performances, les compétences, et le comportement des employés ou les besoins de l’entreprise.

A leading Defense Organization is looking to add a Cyber Engineer to their team! * ***************Please only apply if you have an active clearance******************* Description:* Provide support to certification and accreditation implementing the Risk Management Framework (RMF) across multiple classification domains and update status in the Enterprise Mission Assurance Support Service (eMASS) system. Work as an integrated team member in a highly dynamic, operationally sensitive environment providing mission critical data to the war fighter. Communicate and coordinate across the IA team for cyber-related issues. Analyze security risks, threats and vulnerabilities from multiple sources and recommend strategies to leadership to prevent security exposures and detect intruders. Create plans to implement solutions and follow them through to completion keeping the team and management informed. Remain current on Operational Orders technical applicability and create compliance determinations. Stay current with Government and industry trends, laws and standards and recommend methods to meet requirements. Analyze and define information security requirements for current and future internal and external data connections and maintain documentation for those connections in a central repository. Coordinate with outside test teams for independent vulnerability testing of the MMC IA posture and conduct Radiant Mercury (RM) annual Joint Vulnerability Assessment Program (JVAP) accreditation. Document IA processes and update document repository. Perform and document Account Access Authorization and Control for all on-premises and cloud systems assigned, including maintenance of AARegister artifacts for all on-premises and cloud systems assigned. Collaborate with network administrators to develop and maintain DISA compliant Ports Protocols Services Management (PPSM) data for all on-premises and cloud systems assigned. Develop and maintain SV-3 formatted descriptions of authorized intra-system interfaces between all on-premises and cloud systems assigned. Collaborate with configurations management to develop and maintain authorized software lists for all types of on-premises and cloud systems assigned. Desired experience with McAfee ePolicy Orchestrator, Host Based Security System (HBSS) firewall and threat prevention, Assured Compliance Assessment Solution (ACAS), and Security Content Automation Program (SCAP)/Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG). Position Requirements:* AAS/BA/BS preferred, (HSD or equivalent required) Ability to perform multiple projects with dynamic tasking and follow-through from initial contact to end on assigned tasks. Ability to work as an integrated member of a dynamic and mission focused team to promote a cooperative working environment and a positive team atmosphere. Knowledge of cross-domain solutions. Working knowledge of cyber doctrine and industry IA best practices. Working knowledge of network protocols and MS Windows defense and threat mitigation. Ability to work in a MS Windows virtualized environment. The ability to think analytically and approach issues logically and systematically. Excellent spoken and written communications skills An active clearance is required. Nice to have: CISSP, CISM, CASP, C|EH, CHFI Travel: Occasional (2-4 times/years) Certifications Required: CompTIA Security+ Skills:* information assurance, ACAS, risk management, STIGs, HBSS, Vulnerability assessment, Information security, Emass Top Skills Details:* information assurance, ACAS, risk management Additional Skills & Qualifications:* certifications and clearance Experience Level:* Intermediate Level  About Actalent:  Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Deine Aufgaben  In unserem multi­dis­zi­plinären Team arbeitest du Seite an Seite mit erfahrenen Software Engineers, Data Scientists und Project Managers. Bei uns erwartet dich ein Umfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und offener Kommunikation, wo du viel Verantwortung und Einfluss übernehmen kannst.  Projektleitung in innovativen und massgeschneiderten Kundenprojekten  Analysieren von komplexen Kundenanforderungen und Erarbeiten von intelligenten Lösungen zusammen mit unseren Kunden  Verantwortung vom Konzept bis zur Umsetzung der fertigen Applikation  Mitarbeit in der Entwicklung von anspruchsvollen Webapplikationen wobei die Projektleitung im Fokus steht    Qualifikationen  Dein Profil  Abgeschlossenes Informatik- oder Ingenieur-Studium oder gleichwertige Ausbildung/Erfahrung  Mindestens 2-4 Jahre Erfahrung als Software Engineer  Idealerweise mind. 1-2 Jahre Erfahrung als Projektleiter in der Umsetzung von Softwareprojekten  Hohe Kundenorientierung und initiative Persönlichkeit  Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung von Webapplikationen in den Bereichen Frontend, Backend oder Datenbanken (z.B. JavaScript-Frameworks, Python, SQL- oder NoSQL-Datenbanken)  Verständnis für statistische Fragestellungen im Rahmen von Business- und Data-Analytics-Lösungen  Sehr gute kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Deutsch und Englisch     Zu unserem Technologiestack gehören u.a.: React, Javascript, Node.js, Python, PHP7, Go, GraphQL, Postgres, MongoDB, Docker und Git.      Zusätzliche Informationen  Unser Angebot  Attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen mit variablem Vergütungsanteil  Flexibles Work Smart-Konzept mit Home Office-Möglichkeit  Erfrischende, professionelle und kollegiale Unternehmenskultur mit tollen Events  Hoher Teamspirit, flache Hierarchien und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben  Schöner Arbeitsplatz im Zentrum von Zürich mit moderner Infrastruktur  Weiterbildungsbudget sowie weitere attraktive Fringe Benefits     Kontakt   Bei offenen Fragen steht dir Michelle Hiestand, Talent Acquisition gerne unter michelle.hiestand@wuestpartner.com zur Verfügung.   Wir freuen uns auf dich!   Datahouse AG, Bleicherweg 5, 8001 Zürich   Eine Tochtergesellschaft der Wüest Partner AG

CTS is comprised of individuals with a passion for delivering superior service and innovative solutions. Our team brings exceptional understanding of our client's challenges and a wide variety of financial, business, management, and technical services to our customers in support of specialized intelligence, defense, and business missions. CTS brings a unique level of expertise to its customers. Our team has decades of direct mission engagement within the IC and DOD as well as broad expertise in commercial and private sector disciplines. Named one of "Best Places to Work in 2020 and 2021" by the Washington Business Journal, Counter Threat Solutions (CTS) is a Woman-Owned Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business providing professional and technical solutions to clients in the Intelligence Community (IC) and beyond.  We invest in our people! Check out our 5-Star Glassdoor reviews and compare our full paid Health care benefits, PTO, 401K, and annual continuing education allowance with your current situation!  We seek ambitious Data and Cloud Security professionals with TS/Polygraph Clearance for challenging opportunities in Northern VA.  Day/Core Hours  Data and Cloud Security  Process of ensuring data storage, retention, and access is compliant with Agency policies, and to initiate and maintain accreditation for data science compute environments  Skills Required To Be Successful Determining technical (e.g., Operating System (OS), cloud environment, compute, storage, data) and security ((e.g., INT overlays, System Security Plan (SSP)) requirements for transitioning to enterprise all the diverse types of data science tools and analytics. Map technical requirements to cloud resources available in the Sponsor's environment to ensure optimal resource allocation and usage. Create virtual private clouds (VPCs) Iv4ithin Client's cloud environments to host applications, tools, and/or data sets required for the transition project What We Are Looking For Four (4) year Degree in Data Science or Computer related field. Minimum three (2-3) years- experience Customer service skills. Ability to work under collaboratively with others and effective under pressure. This is not an exhaustive description of this opportunity. Let's have a talk!  About Counter Threat Solutions (CTS): CTS is a Woman-Owned Service- Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) consultancy to the Federal government with a focus on the Intelligence and Defense communities. We provide mission-savvy subject matter experts and deliver innovative solutions to our clients. As such, we seek people passionate about their career specialty and we reward our team members with competitive pay and a comprehensive benefits package that includes 100% paid medical, dental and vision care premiums; a retirement plan with company match and immediate vesting @ 6%; a generous annual training/tuition allowance; 6 weeks total paid time off; and performance-based merit increases and incentives.  Counter Threat Solutions is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of age, color, disability, sex, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, or any classification protected by federal, state, or local law.

Desired Python-Django developers must have skills in python, Django, and Django Rest API. Basic idea of Kubernetes / Docker (Worked in a SaaS / Container Env) Good To Have Strong Problem Solving / Algorithmic Skills Understanding of OS Concepts like Multi-threading / Multi-Process, Concurrency, Synchronization Primitives, Memory Management Worked with NoSQL Databases like Mongo, Elastic, Cassandra Network Security Domain Experience is a Plus (not mandatory) Ideal candidate would have the above skills and also need to know any JavaScript library like React JS, Vue JS, Angular JS, etc. Proficient in one or more of the well-known Programming Languages like Python, NodeJS (Proficiency in other programming languages is also fine, but, must be ready to code in Python / NodeJS/ GoLang) Forward suitable profiles to careers@goodbits.in  NB: In case you receive any fraudulent communication for a Job offer/ interview call against payment of money, please stay alert. TD Description  All companies are not the same. What makes TD special as a business is also, what makes us special as an employer.  Why TD?  TD's Colleague Promise: A better you. A better us.  A more confident you means a stronger us. We empower you to grow your skills, gain new perspectives, and create impact at work and in your community. That's our unique and inclusive culture.  Department Overview  Co-op and Internship opportunities allow you to gain valuable work experience across a number of the businesses at TD. You will work with experienced colleagues, receive world class training, and be part of a community of students across TD, where you will have an impact, grow as individual and experience our culture of care.  Our Co-op/Intern Programming is offered with select Co-op and Internship roles, and is designed to help you better understand the TD business, build on critical career capabilities, and broaden your professional network. This program is designed to complement your on-the job experience and features: Leadership talks with key Leaders from across the organization Lunch and Learns on topics such as Innovation Diversity and Inclusion and Personal Branding and so much more  Job Description  Are you someone that enjoys solving complex problems? Do you love thinking creatively about what could go wrong, and then coming up with plans to avoid it?  Then you should join our Enterprise Protect organization! Multiple roles that support Cyber engineering are available, including: Cyber Security Risk Officers analyze, report on, and mitigate risks related to technology, data, vendors, applications, infrastructure, information, and Cloud. Each of the Cyber Security Risk Officer roles focuses on managing technology and information security risk in compliance with the organization's risk appetite. Cyber Security Analysts operate cyber security tooling, execute processes and procedures related to cyber security, and provide defense in-depth capabilities related to technology, data, applications, infrastructure, and Cloud environments. Each of the Cyber Security Analyst roles focuses on operational execution of security controls and tooling in order to better defend, identify, and secure systems and technology in compliance with the organization's risk appetite. Cyber Security Engineers test and implement cyber security solutions, build automation and integration solutions between cyber security tooling, and provide expert guidance on cyber security tooling capabilities. Each of the Cyber Security Engineer roles focuses on specialized areas of security tooling in order to better defend, identify, and secure systems and technology in compliance with the organization's risk appetite. Fraud Technology Analysts help manage technology applications that deliver operational and analytic outputs that deliver fraud detection and prevention controls to protect the Bank and its customers. Fraud Technology Analysts also may perform non-technical roles supporting the Fraud Technology Solutions team through governance and compliance activities, business processes, and performance management.  Job Requirements Currently enrolled in relevant technology programs, such as Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology Management, Financial Analysis and Risk Management, Computing, etc. Familiarity with Jira and Confluence A thirst for constantly exploring emerging technology Prior experience in the cyber domain would be an asset, including but not limited to: Identifying, assessing, measuring and reporting on technology risks Subject matter expertise in keeping infrastructure & applications secure, including disaster recovery, security architecture, data loss prevention, and application security services Experience in evaluations of detective cyber security controls, including testing and improvement of new capabilities within existing tooling Incident response, and minimizing business impacts of cyber events    Additional Information  Please note that this is a general posting. If you are selected for an interview, more information regarding which business group and the specific job duties will be provided.  Early Talent Requirements This position is a 4-month work term and will commence September 6th – December 23rd, 2022. Applications must include a transcript, cover letter (one letter-sized page or less) and a resume (maximum of 2 pages). We welcome all applications; however, we will only contact qualified candidates chosen for an interview. Thank you for your interest. TD requires employees to reside in the country where the role is located, irrespective of remote working arrangements  Assigned Line of Business Requirements Please note that the line of business that you are assigned to may require specific skills not mentioned in this posting  Inclusiveness  At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

job_title: IT Application and Infrastructure Audit Professional, Officer
desc: The Business Aligned IT Auditor will be responsible for working on audit engagements that focus on business risk and related application technology. Team members work to understand business risks and related application controls such as interface controls, logical access controls, and input/processing/output controls. The main objective of an audit is to provide management with independent, objective assurance regarding the design and operating effectiveness of the system of internal controls to mitigate both business and IT-related risks. The audit follows a collaborative approach, with business and IT audit team members jointly conducting the majority of internal and client-facing planning, control assessment, testing, and reporting activities.  The Business Aligned IT Auditor will help shape the audit scope for IT coverage, assess procedures and test application controls for audits utilizing a risk-based audit approach. The application controls subject to testing will be determined during the risk and controls assessment phase of the audit and will most likely include: electronic authorizations; application parameters, settings, edit checks, scripts, and mappings; application access to sensitive application transactions and shared directories; system interfaces; and management, edit, and exception reports.  The Business Aligned IT Auditor ensures their work is completed in compliance with the Corporate Audit Department and Institute of Internal Auditor standards. The candidate requires good analytical, interpersonal, time management, project management, research and communications skills. She /he must be able to effectively work with new and changing situations, including new industry regulations, where there may not always be a readily apparent solution. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Security, Information Systems, Civil Engineering, Accounting, Management Science or a related field, or its equivalent; 1+ years of experience with IT and Operations auditing, risk management, or IT compliance. Proven knowledge of Information security, system development lifecycle, IT project management and end-user computing; Demonstrated experience testing IT general controls and application controls including electronic authorizations, application parameters, settings and/or scripts, and access to sensitive application transactions and data interfaces; Preferred Qualifications Ability to think strategically and multi-task in a fast-paced environment Experience in a number of the following: technology consulting, system auditing, privacy, cyber-security, Public and Private Cloud, software development, financial processes and systems, large project systems integration, risk management, or data analytics. Demonstrated knowledge of Institute of Internal Auditors, Corporate Audit Division standards, NIST, COSO, COBIT, ITIL, ISO 27001, Sarbanes-Oxley and SOC 1 / SSAE 16 standards and laws and regulations applicable to the assigned area of responsibility. Audit experience in public accounting or internal audit, focusing on financial service or other regulated industries Excellent analytical, written communication, interpersonal, organizational and presentation skills Industry recognized certification CISA, CISSP, CISM, AICPA Interest in Corporate Compliance, Financial Services and/or Anti-Money Laundering  COVID-19 Protocols: Complying with State Street’s COVID-19 protocols is a condition of employment. Those requirements may vary depending on circumstances and legal requirements, and may include, without limitation, a requirement to be vaccinated (or have an accommodation), to disclose vaccination status, to provide evidence of vaccination status, etc.  Job ID: R-672259
Industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

desc: Who We Are  Motive builds technology to improve the safety, productivity, and profitability of businesses that power the physical economy. The Motive Automated Operations Platform combines IoT hardware with AI-powered applications to automate vehicle and equipment tracking, driver safety, compliance, maintenance, spend management, and more. Motive serves more than 120,000 businesses, across a wide range of industries including trucking and logistics, construction, oil and gas, food and beverage, field service, agriculture, passenger transit, and delivery.  Motive is proud to be a Forbes Cloud 100 company and a 2020 Career-Launching Company by Wealthfront.  About The Role  The Senior Security and Compliance Engineer, a thought leader residing within our security organization, is responsible for implementing and maintaining the compliance management framework and program. This position will be part of a team of security experts and work with technology and legal partners and business units to meet our global security compliance needs.  The ideal candidate should have extensive experience in developing, deploying, and maturing compliance management frameworks and programs, a deep understanding of general security technologies and best practices, and knowledge of global data privacy laws and regulations. This role must collaborate effectively with development, engineering, and operations counterparts as well as internal and external partners to assess, report, and maintain compliance against applicable security industry standards and regulatory requirements.  What You’ll Do Promote, drive & track adoption of centralized security and compliance services across the company Partner with Motive development teams to help them understand their security and compliance requirements, document onboarding procedures, and make it easy for them to adopt security and compliance services Implement and support the deployment of new security technologies, both software and hardware, across the company including both cloud security and IoT security solutions for the protection of the organization based on the latest threats Drive and track the overall work across our platform to close open vulnerabilities, security defects, and compliance failures Lead internal and 3rd party audits to ensure successful, high-quality, on-time audits Engage with development teams and internal/external auditors as required during an audit to facilitate audit interviews, help gather audit evidence, and remediate any audit findings Partner with development teams to help inform the product roadmap and provide user feedback that will be used to improve security and compliance services What We’re Looking For A minimum experience of 3 years developing security tooling, automation, and integrations. A minimum of 2 years of experience in cloud security and application security. A minimum of 2 years of experience in information security compliance and assurance, including compliance assessment, audit, controls monitoring, and compliance metrics Possess a bachelor’s degree or higher in the field of information security, engineering, computer science, or equivalent advanced technology field of study Knowledge of security and data privacy standards, regulations, and guidelines such as ISO 27k, SOC 2, PCI DSS, NIST, CIS, GDPR, CCPA Experience developing and deploying compliance management frameworks and programs, preferably with international experience in e-commerce or technology-related industry Familiarity with fully automated controls, control testing automation, Compliance-as-Code (CaC), Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC), and DevSecOps. 2+ years of experience assessing and analyzing the operations, processes, and procedures of various business units as it relates to security controls. Creating a diverse and inclusive workplace is one of Motive's core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives.  Please do not let an arrest or conviction record prevent you from applying for employment at Motive. Motive considers qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Please review our Candidate Privacy Notice here.
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Internet Publishing, and Truck Transportation

desc: Job Description:* Our client is currently seeking a Staff Architect to join their well established and growing healthcare practice in Orlando. This person will work on a 3-5 person project team, supporting multiple large healthcare systems in Florida. The Staff Architect works with a team of Architectural Designers, Project Architects, and a Project Manager.  Duties and Responsibilities include: Uses independent judgment in evaluation, selection, and use of standard techniques, but functions as a collaborative member of a team Independently solves problems and reviews findings with team leader Compiles data, performs design computations, and executes all necessary code analysis with guidance from team leader Makes quantity takeoffs Prepares architectural renderings and documentation in coordination with internal and external team members Inspects architectural features of projects in field with assistance from team leader Receives technical guidance Receives supervisory approval on project documentation Checks own work for quality control on a regular basis; ensures that work is reviewed by team leader Coordinates assigned tasks with team leader according to workplan Maintains project files and records (electronic and otherwise) in an organized fashion that is readily identifiable and coordinated with team members Possesses diverse knowledge of architecture principles and practices Uses advanced techniques while performing work Responsible for complete documentation, specifications, and material selection Qualifications:* Bachelors and/or Masters in Architecture with 2-5 years’ experience. Healthcare experience is a plus. Registration is a plus. Must have experience using Revit for design development and construction documents. CD, CA experience preferred. Building Core & Shell and/or Interior experience is ideal. Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment. Strong communication skills and the ability to use sound/independent judgment. Qualified candidates must have a polished portfolio that represents their work well and the ability to speak about the projects in the portfolio, including what they did on these projects. Minneapolis Data Science Tutor Jobs  The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Data Science tutors nationally and in Minneapolis. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.  Why join our platform? Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week. Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want. Set your own hours and schedule. Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients). Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform. Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus. We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session. What We Look For In a Tutor You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality. You can show subject-matter expertise in Data Science. You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student. Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform: 1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience. Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience. VT+ Classes: teach groups of 25-30 students anything from math fundamentals to video game design. Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time. School@Home: provide support for homeschooling parents with 1-on-1 Online Tutoring and Small Group Classes. Instant Tutoring: accept subject specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like. About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring  Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.  Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.

Where: Sloterdijk, Amsterdam Max rate: 68,50€ Start date: ASAP Knowledge of Python is a must. Azure and SQL are preferred, Experience in data management/analysis +-1 year. English is a must, preferably also Dutch. Presence required at least once a week in the office in Amsterdam. Why  We are working on creating a future-proof data landscape, for which our team works on building/managing reference data management and a master data management solution. We need your help to build and integrate these solutions with the rest of the KPN departments.  Where  At the moment, the team is working from home. After Covid, you will probably sometimes work at the office and sometimes from home. Our office is at Sloterdijk, Amsterdam, where we work together with three other scrum teams on the same floor. Together we created a really fun and inspiring place to work.  Team  You will be working with 2 other curious developers, a PO, and Scrum Master.  Our Way of Working  Within the data office department of KPN, we have adopted Agile and work according to the Scrum methodology. We are convinced of the value of “We Make-We Own” and have embedded DevOps in our development teams. We aim for the best results by hiring best-in-class developers and giving the teams as much autonomy as possible. We believe we have created an inspiring environment for personal development and a great and fun place to work!  Responsibilities Managing data management application Create integration solutions in python Create new application for Fiber upgrade program Developing Python APIs for Master data management Create and deploy solutions in Cloud (Azure and AWS) Create powerBI dashboards Education, Experience, And Licensing Requirements Python backend development 1-2 years Rest APIs Microservices Docker Kafka hands-on experience CI-CD tools ( Jenkins, Airflow ) - good to have Data processing (ETL) with python – good to have AWS/Azure knowledge - preferable certification (developer or data Engineer)

job_title: Sr Staff Scientist, R&D (Molecular biology / NGS / Genomics)
desc: We are looking for a Sr. Staff Scientist to join our R&D team and help us develop the next generation of products for Twist. Our focus in R&D is the development of a full system of NGS/Genomics products (library preparation, target enrichment, NGS sequencing) that enable customers in various applications like viral detection, liquid biopsy, oncology, inherited disease, ag-Bio, and others. Working at Twist, you will leverage our cutting-edge DNA synthesis platform to develop new products in the NGS / genomics space. As a senior individual contributor you will drive innovation, experimental planning and execution, and product development in all stages. You will also mentor other scientists in the team and provide guidance and input on all technical aspects of the work in R&D.  Your Responsibilities Will Include  Twist Bioscience has developed a unique platform to synthesize DNA on silicon. This technology enables us to make unprecedented numbers of oligos and long DNA while maintaining the ability to select out small subsets of oligos when required. The R&D team at Twist focuses on leveraging this revolutionary platform to develop new products and applications in the synthetic biology and NGS fields. The successful candidate will have a proven track record of developing innovative products, from conception to commercial launch, in the NGS / genomics space. A deep understanding of molecular biology, next-generation sequencing, and bioinformatics methods are required. Managing a portfolio of product development projects, with a focus on genomics products (library preparation and target capture for NGS) Ensuring that product development progresses quickly and efficiently, in accordance with company goals Designing and executing experiments, and communicating results clearly and succinctly to stakeholders, management, and other teams Providing technical leadership to other scientists and research associates Collaborating with other teams to ensure smooth technology transfer, QC, supply chain, etc. Being the ultimate subject matter expert in molecular biology and genomics Qualifications PhD with 6+ years post-graduate experience or Master’s degree with 10+ years in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Genetics, Genomics, Chemistry or closely-related field. Experience in NGS/Genomics at a biotech/life science company is required Deep experience developing molecular biology products in NGS / genomics Expert understanding of molecular biology techniques including NGS library preparation, target enrichment, DNA modifications, DNA amplification/purification, DNA quantitation/characterization (dPCR, qPCR, chromatography), etc. Deep understanding of NGS platforms and technologies and hands-on experience with various NGS library preparation methods and sequencing applications (WGS, WES, single-cell sequencing, etc) Experienced with bioinformatics and bioinformatics tools such as genome alignment, mapping, variant calling and annotation. Past experiences demonstrating capabilities to perform basic analysis and communicate needs with bioinformaticians Must have a strong background in developing molecular biology methods and workflows, with a particular emphasis on NGS/genomics Experience developing products for commercial launch Excellent written and verbal communication skills Dynamic interpersonal skills. Respectful and open to others’ views; contribute to building a positive team spirit High attention to detail Thrives in a fast-paced environment Programming experience is a plus About Twist Bioscience  Twist Bioscience synthesizes genes from scratch, known as “writing” DNA. Just as children learn to both read and write, the next phase of development for the genomics revolution is the ability to write DNA.  At Twist Bioscience, we work in service of people who are changing the world for the better. In fields such as health care, agriculture, industrial chemicals and data storage, our unique silicon-based DNA Synthesis Platform provides precision at a scale that is otherwise unavailable to our customers.  Twist Bioscience Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Twist Bioscience Corporation provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic characteristics, or any other category protected by law.

desc: 职位来源于智联招聘。  Job Description & Summary  A career in Information Technology, within Internal Firm Services, will provide you with the opportunity to support our core business functions by deploying applications that enable our people to work more efficiently and deliver the highest levels of service to our clients. You’ll focus on managing the design and implementation of technology infrastructure within PwC, developing and enhancing both client and internal facing applications within PwC, and providing technology tools that help create a competitive advantage for the Firm to drive strategic business growth.  Our Applications Programming - Practice Support team helps translate PwC’s business requirements through efficient and effective Information Technology software applications. We design, develop, test, and implement sophisticated software applications in support of the firms needs and requirements.  To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.  Responsibilities  PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to  As a Senior Associate, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.  Use feedback and reflection to develop self awareness, personal strengths and address development areas.  Delegate to others to provide stretch opportunities, coaching them to deliver results.  Demonstrate critical thinking and the ability to bring order to unstructured problems.  Use a broad range of tools and techniques to extract insights from current industry or sector trends.  Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance.  Know how and when to use tools available for a given situation and can explain the reasons for this choice.  Seek and embrace opportunities which give exposure to different situations, environments and perspectives.  Use straightforward communication, in a structured way, when influencing and connecting with others.  Able to read situations and modify behavior to build quality relationships.  Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct.  岗位职责： 负责业务系统前、后端开发工作； 负责系统需求的分析、调研以及相关部署方案的编写； 技术发展路线的制定，技术方案的选型、技术架构的设计； 研发基础服务、标准代码框架、代码库等的构建。 任职要求： 至少5年以上.NET平台开发经验； 熟悉.NET Core技术； 有云开发经验者优先。 有大数据开发经验者优先。 有Docker、微服务项目经验优先； 有良好的沟通、协调能力和团队合作精神。 Job Responsibilities Responsible for the front-end and back-end development of the business system; Responsible for the analysis and research of system requirements and the preparation of related deployment plans; Formulation of technical development routes, selection of technical solutions, and design of technical architecture; Construction of basic R&D services, standard code framework, code base, etc. Job Requirements  Graduate with 5+ years of experience in Microsoft .NET technology;  Should have strong experience working with .Net, especially .NET Core;  Experience in Cloud development is preferred. Experience in Docker and microservice projects is preferred;  Experience in Big Data is preferred;  Good communication skills, understanding skills and team spirit, and a strong sense of responsibility;  Initiative driven by responsibility Capability to build a system Curiosity and willingness to learn exceeds the requirements of the position Toughness. job_title: PPC Paid Media Account Manager - Flexible. Part Time. Remote
desc: Are you looking for your next career opportunity with an award-winning agency that is known for developing and rewarding its team?Are you looking for a more flexible gig to fit around life commitments. Are you looking for a better work / life balance?Do you have a love for Paid Digital Media and want to work for some of the biggest brands in the UK?Then look no further! (Note: this is a flexible, work life balance role vs freelance side hustle :-) )An awesome opportunity has arisen for a PPC Paid Media Account Manager to join a fun and hard-working team where you will be responsible for deploying PPC campaigns on a variety of platforms. Demand from the likes Arsenal FC, Wilkinson Sword and JVC Kenwood means that we are expanding the team again. Come join and be part of our journey!Role Info:Flexible PPC Paid Media Account ManagerLondon or Remote£40,000 - £50,000 FTE (depending on experience)Plus great perks including 10% bonus + health insurance3 days / 22.5 hours per week (all working patterns considered)Culture / Values: Take Care. Ask Why. Work Smart. Enjoy the RideFun, supportive and hard-working team. Don’t believe us? Check out our Glassdoor 5 stars!“Fosters your growth and amazing company culture”“An excellent team & high standards of work”“Great company to work for, lots of freedom”“Friendly agency with a supportive culture”Who we are:As an industry-leading Digital Marketing Agency specialising in SEO, PPC, and digital PR, we offer a wide range of services to clients across a range of industries, including large retail brands, legal and finance.We're an enthusiastic and diligent group with a unique blend of creative, technical, and marketing brains. Through rigorous and effective people development, our multi-disciplined team of experts live and breathe to provide exceptional service and results for our clients.The Flexible PPC Paid Media Account Manager role:Our aim is to offer results driven, measurable and exciting PPC strategies to our clients.We are on the hunt for our next fantastic new addition who has a passion for everything paid digital media. Someone who enjoys working with numbers, is a forward thinker, has superb attention to detail and proven experience dealing with multiple PPC accounts.You will be managing PPC campaigns across a variety of platforms, including Google Ads and Microsoft, Facebook and other social media, as well as providing detailed data analysis and conversion rate tracking.You will also be interacting with clients on a day-to-day basis. Therefore, exceptional communication skills are a must.The Perfect Candidate:+ At least 2+ years’ agency experience+ Strong knowledge of Google Ads with a familiarity with Shopping Ads and Merchant Centre+ Knowledge of managing campaigns on a variety of platforms (Microsoft, Facebook and LinkedIn Ads)+ Experience working with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager+ Good understanding of conversion rate optimisation (CRO)+ Comfortable with handling large amounts of data and producing actionable insights+ Proficient with Excel/Google Sheets+ Strong attention to detail+ Confident with dealing with clients and managing expectations+ Ability to mentoring and train more junior members of the teamWhy Us?We have some great perks on offer including: up to 10% bonus, 28 days’ holiday (prorated for part time), private health insurance, allocated training budget and focus on continuous personal development, sensible work/life balance, as well as a friendly, fun and sociable team (to name but a few).We consider ourselves to be a flexible employer and do our best to facilitate any requests regarding working pattern and location.We have offices in Rickmansworth, Hertfordshire and Old Street in London where the majority of our staff work 'hybridly' with time at home, but we will be happy to consider fully remote working for this role also.For more information on working life at Distinctly, please have a read through our team handbook https://bit.ly/38nyzNlSounds like a good fit? Apply here for a fast-track path to the Agency DirectorsYour Experience / Background / Previous Roles May Include:PPC Marketing, Performance Marketing, PPC Marketing, Google Ads, Search Marketing, Paid Search, Paid Advertising, PPC Account Manager, PPC Manager, Paid Search Executive, Performance Marketing Manager, Paid Media Manager.Application notice... We take your privacy seriously. As you might expect you may be contacted by email, text or telephone. Your data is processed by our talent partner Recruitment Revolution on the basis of their legitimate interests in fulfilling the recruitment process. Please refer to their Data Privacy Policy & Notice on their website for further details.

JOB STATUS: OPEN  POSTING NUMBER: 00049179  SCHOOL YEAR: 2021-2022  CALENDAR: District Support / Full Year  CLOSING DATE: 04/24/2022 04:00 PM  POSTING NUMBER: 00049179  LOCATION: 068:TECHNOLOGY DEPT  POSITION TITLE: System Administrator: Education Technology  Job Description  Support the continuous operation of Educational Technology and other web-based applications. Installs and maintains systems, applications, upgrades, tests, patches, and makes performance assessments and enhancements on systems.  Essential Functions Designs, installs, configures, monitors, supports and troubleshoots all components of designated system(s). Provides technical assistance, recommendations and consultations to District employees in the operation of Educational Technologies/Communication Systems and other web/cloud-based applications while supporting technology systems and equipment (computers, peripherals, software programs, etc.) used for student instruction and administrative applications. Assists users in preparing systems for interoperability for both hardware and software. Proposes recommendations for new or existing policies, which directly or indirectly impact systems use and system administration. Works closely with curriculum and instruction, library services and other departments, administrators and teachers to define requirements and assist with the distribution and integration of educational technology applications. Designs, builds, configures, installs, monitors, supports and provides documentation for EdTech applications, including various digital learning platforms for the entire school district. Designs, configures, manages, tests, updates and monitors highly scalable EdTech application systems. Oversees operating systems, applications, upgrades, patches, and makes performance assessments and enhancements on EdTech application systems. Serves as a liaison between EdTech and other technology divisions for coordination of support efforts. Researches and recommends innovative approaches for EdTech tasks. Identifies solutions that leverage resources and minimize administrative time and effort. Optimizes available tools and resources to maximize systems usage and capacity. Contributes to District technology security and data integrity improvement programs and policy enforcement. Provides assistance to external departmental managers and leaders with application-based projects. Monitors systems performance and utilization to conduct growth analysis and capacity planning on District application systems. Actively maintains knowledge currency on state-of-the-art educational technology, applications and systems. Establishes and maintains systems standards and assists with change control. Develops and maintains application systems administration procedures, operations, and documentation to achieve optimum availability. Assists immediate supervisor with the development/implementation of a plan of action for completing requested projects/programs. Troubleshoots and identifies application systems problems/failures and takes appropriate action. Provides support related to educational technology systems and training of those systems. Plans and tests procedures and data for system testing as needed. Assists in facilitating workshops rainings with the EdTech resource teachers. Ability to take ownership of assigned responsibilities and follow through to effective resolution. Ability to troubleshoot and find solutions if new or unique problems are presented. Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities And Experience Three or more years of experience in the form of managing large application environments Associates degree with heavy concentration in Information Technology with certification Experience in designing, building, configuring, installing, managing, monitoring and support of Application systems Experience in designing, configuring, managing, and reporting of IT Service Management systems and Google for Education Applications Experience in designing, building, configuring, installing, managing, and reporting of Single Sign-On systems and Office 365 systems Experience in designing, building, configuring, installing, managing, and distribution of assessment applications and educational Web 2.0 applications System administration competence with Educational Technology platforms Experience in creating documentation, and diagrams Experience in performance assessments and enhancements Experience in monitoring system application performance Proficient in word processing, database, and spreadsheet software Knowledge of computer equipment and associated peripheral device. Motivated, self-starter who can work with limited supervision Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment Requirements High School diploma or equivalent Minimum of three years of combined experience in programming and/or systems administration Contact Information  Contact: Shellmarie Harris at / harris_s@aps.edu  Apply To  www.aps.edu District Support application. A cover letter, resume and any other supporting documents MUST be submitted prior to 4:00 PM on the closing date of the advertisement for the application to be considered complete.  Additional Info  GRADE / LEVEL: 10  SALARY: $25.74  DAYS: 256  HOURS: 8  START DATE: ASAP

company: 株式会社ＮＴＴデータグローバル・サービス
desc: 【仕事内容】  「プロジェクトマネージャー（イントラマート導入）」のポジションの求人です  業務パッケージ（IntraMart）を利用した、顧客向けシステム開発PJのPM業務を担っていただきます。  【採用背景】  IntraMart製品の導入チームの新規設立のため。  【具体的な業務内容】  ■各種工程管理（要件定義、設計、開発、テスト、運用）  ■予算、パートナー管理  ■品質管理  ■顧客コミュニケーション  ■上記の他PJ運営にまつわるマネジメント  【顧客について】  日系製造業界  【組織について】  ビジネスデベロップメント（4名）  ┗新規ビジネスチーム  ★魅力  ■グローバルな風土と日系の安定性のハイブリッド組織  同社はNTTデータのグループ企業という安定性がありつつ、100名弱の組織のため、裁量権が高く融通が利きやすい組織です。  ■グローバルなキャリアを築けます  今回のポジションの顧客は日系企業のため、直接英語は用いりませんが社内のエンジニアの3割は外国籍であるため、これから英語をビジネスで利用していきたいという方には非常におすすめの環境です  ■長期的なキャリア形成が可能な環境  同社は60歳以上の再雇用時、一律に給与が下がる等の制度はなく、ほとんどの方が50代の頃の年収を維持し、60代以降でも活躍されています。年齢関係なく正当な評価を頂ける企業風土がございます。  【求める人材】  【必須要件】  ■プロジェクトマネージャー経験（10名規模以上）  ■英語への抵抗感がない方  （読み書き・メール対応等の業務が発生します）  【歓迎要件】  ■業務PKGソフトウエアの開発・PJマネジメント経験（SAP、MS Dynamics,、IntraMart, Biz∫等）  【給与】  年収 800 ～ 1000 万円  ※裁量労働制の為、残業代込み  ※昇給年1回/賞与年2回  ※給与：賞与＝8 2 がモデルです （賞与は 個人業績による変動制 です ）  なお、経験・スキルに応じて変動の可能性があります  【勤務地】  東京都  港区港南一丁目9番1号 NTT品川TWINS DATA棟 9F  【勤務時間】  09:30～18:30  【雇用・契約形態】  【休日・休暇】  完全週休二日（土日）■国民の祝日■有給休暇（初年度15日）■夏期休暇■年末年始休暇■創立記念日休暇
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Internet Publishing

job_title: Consultant Junior ou confirmé Blockchain/Crypto-actifs/DeFi (Finance décentralisée) - H/F
desc: Passionné(e) par la blockchain, les crypto-actifs et la finance décentralisée et envie d’être pionnier(e) du Web3 ? Rejoins l’équipe Crypto et Blockchain, au sein de l’entité Data Science de Sia Partners !  Nos clients, de grands groupes comme des start-ups, sont à la recherche de nouveaux business models via les technologies de rupture comme la blockchain et les crypto-actifs. Ainsi, nous les accompagnons de bout en bout dans leurs projets.  Voici quelques exemples de réalisations :  Plateformes de tokenisation d’actifs  Société de minage de crypto-actifs  Plateforme décentralisée d’inclusion financière  Crypto-banque  Benchmarks et analyses techniques   Déploiement de notre solution de traçabilité Stratumn  En tant que consultant, tu accompagneras nos clients sur les sujets suivants :  Accompagnement stratégique (définition de business model, analyse de compétitivité)  Cadrage de projet  Analyse technique  Réalisation de projets sur blockchains publiques et privées  Chez Sia Partners les activités internes ont une importance toute particulière, dans ce cadre ta contribution s’articulera autour des axes suivants :  Conduite de travaux de recherche et développement en interne  Rédaction d’études et d’articles techniques  Intervention lors d’évènements de type conférences, petits déjeuners, meet-ups  Mise en place de formations internes et externes, en présentiel ou en ligne  Développement commercial    Qualifications  Les pré-requis :  Tu es diplômé(e) d’une grande école d'ingénieur, université ou école de management  Tu es passionné(e) par l’écosystème crypto-actifs (cryptomonnaies, DeFi, le web3, etc...)  Tu as une bonne connaissance des blockchains publiques (Bitcoin, Ethereum, Avalanche, Solana, etc...)  Français  Anglais courant indispensable   Les plus :  Tu connais le secteur financier   Tu as des compétences en développement ( Solidity, Python, Java)    Informations supplémentaires  Ce que nous offrons :  Un salaire compétitif   Faire partie d'une entreprise internationale à croissance rapide  Capacité à travailler sur des missions internationales  Travailler chez un client, en télé-travail et dans notre bureau au 21 rue de Berri  Sia Partners est un employeur qui souscrit au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Tous les aspects de l’emploi, tels que le recrutement, les promotions, la rémunération, ou les sanctions sont basés uniquement sur les performances, les compétences, et le comportement des employés ou les besoins de l’entreprise.

Job Title: Program Director, Diversity & Inclusion  Location: Tallahassee, FL  Regular/Temporary: Regular  Full/Part Time: Full-Time  Job ID: 51673  Department  The Office of Admissions  Equal Employment Opportunity  An Equal Opportunity/Access/Affirmative Action/Pro Disabled & Veteran Employer.  FSU's Equal Opportunity Statement can be accessed at: https://hr.fsu.edu/sites/g/files/upcbnu2186/files/PDF/Publications/diversity/EEO_Statement.pdf.  Responsibilities  Position is responsible for the development, coordination, supervision and assessment of multicultural student recruitment and enhancement programs within the Office of Admissions that promote diversity and inclusion to the University. Directs the strategic planning, administration, assessment and implementation of multicultural recruitment activities and programs for historically underrepresented, first-generation, and socioeconomically disadvantaged student populations.  Responsible for the development, coordination, management, and assessment of the University’s multicultural student recruitment and enhancement programs to attract students from historically underrepresented, first generation and socioeconomically disadvantaged areas. Directs the strategic planning, administration, assessment and implementation of diversity and inclusion program for the Office of Admissions. Serves as an advocate to prospective students and families, by providing academic and programmatic resources to programs including the High School Partners Program (HSPP), CARE Summer Bridge Program, SSTRIDE Program, and QUEST Scholars Program to enhance communication, access, application completion, and enrollment of underrepresented populations. Implements targeted recruitment campaigns and activities to achieve program goals.  Provides leadership in the development and implementation of diversity and inclusion programs. Seeks innovative solutions to bridge the gap with prospective students and families and connect them with the financial resources available to reduce financial barriers. Partners with the CARE Program and the Office of Financial Aid staff to develop programs and activities to increase financial literacy and FAFSA completion for target populations. Assists in the development of donor relationships to increase charitable giving for the High School Partners Program.  Extensive travel to high schools and college fairs. Due to travel needs, position requires operation of a motor vehicle. Frequently conducting information sessions, reviewing and evaluating applications for admission to HSPP, SSTRIDE , QUEST, and the CARE Summer Bridge Program, making recommendations on student selection. Counsels prospective students and their family members about the educational and financial aid opportunities at the University. Frequent contact with high school counselors, principals, teachers, and officials from other colleges and universities. Occasional contact with personnel from ACT, College Board, and other outside vendors.  Responsible for the collection of statistical data for diverse student populations. Participates in strategic planning, staffing decisions and program development for the Office of Admissions to ensure program goals, objectives and activities meet academic support and University standards. Develops and maintains partnerships with various stakeholders across Enrollment Management and the University to achieve departmental goals and objectives.  Contributes to long-range planning and provides recommendations to the Director to increase diversity program offerings for the University. Assists other sections during peak times in support of the goals of the Office of Admissions.  Qualifications  A Bachelor's degree and 6 years of experience, or a combination of post high school education and experience equal to 10 years. Experience should be relevant and related to the responsibilities of the job. Qualified candidates will possess the ability to prioritize and organize multiple work assignments simultaneously. Candidates must have previous experience working with diverse college student populations. Qualified candidates will have excellent oral and written communication skills, with experience creating and delivering presentations to small and large diverse group. Applicants must have experience using Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook or comparable software.  Candidates must attach a resume to be considered for the position.  Applicants must have a valid Driver's License to be eligible for position.  Preferred  A Master's degree in an appropriate area of specialization and complimentary experience is preferred. We seek energetic candidates who are detail-oriented and who work well independently as well as in a team. Experience working with diverse populations, reviewing transcripts, and interpreting and applying admissions tests is preferred. Candidates should have the ability to review, analyze, formulate, and organize data and information and follow through on assignments. Applicants should be able to establish and maintain effective working relationships and be able to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Candidates with a strong sense of initiative and the demonstrated ability to manage multiple responsibilities concurrently are preferred. The ability to make sound judgments while working in a deadline-driven environment is essential.  University Information  One of the nation's elite research universities, Florida State University preserves, expands, and disseminates knowledge in the sciences, technology, arts, humanities, and professions, while embracing a philosophy of learning strongly rooted in the traditions of the liberal arts and critical thinking. Founded in 1851, Florida State University is the oldest continuous site of higher education in Florida. FSU is a community steeped in tradition that fosters research, encourages creativity, and embraces diversity. At FSU, there’s the excitement of being part of a vibrant academic and professional community, surrounded by people whose ideas are shaping tomorrow’s news!  Learn more about our university and campuses.  Anticipated Salary Range  The anticipated hiring salary range is mid 50's to mid 60's commensurate with education and experience.  Pay Plan  This is an A&P (Administrative and Professional) position.  FSU Total Rewards  FSU offers a robust Total Rewards package. Visit our website to learn more about our Compensation, Benefits, Wellness, Recognition, and Employee Development programs.  Use our interactive tool to calculate Total Compensation options based on potential salary, benefits and retirement contributions, earned leave, and other employment-related perks.  Soft Money Funded Position  This is a soft money funded position, with renewal based on available funds and the needs of the University.  Schedule  The normal schedule is M-F, 8-5 with occasional evening and weekends.  Criminal Background Check  This position requires successful completion of a criminal history background check, to include fingerprinting. The background check will be conducted as authorized and in accordance with University Policy 4-OP-C-7-B11.  How To Apply  If qualified and interested in a specific job opening as advertised, apply to Florida State University at https://jobs.fsu.edu. If you are a current FSU employee, apply via myFSU > Self Service.  Applicants are required to complete the online application with all applicable information. Applications must include all work history up to ten years, and education details even if attaching a resume.  Tobacco Free Campus  Effective January 1, 2014, tobacco use, including simulated tobacco use, is prohibited on property, interior and exterior, owned or managed by Florida State University. This policy applies to all Florida State University students, employees, consultants, contractors, visitors, and external individuals.
