desc: Position Summary  Provides leadership of the Advocacy Center including setting a strategic vision that meets the needs of the community and establishes Childhelp as a leader in Child Abuse and Neglect and Advocacy Services, oversight of operations, development and supervision of employees, and facilitating and ensuring effective collaboration with Advocacy Center Partners.  The Director is responsible for ensuring that services including individual, sibling, and family counseling, facilitation of psycho-educational groups, education, family support, court support, and child advocacy to child victims and their non-offending family members in a culturally sensitive manner are offered and makes every effort to ensure that services are not financially prohibitive.  This positions has supervisory direct reports who oversee supervisor and individual contributor roles.  Essential Functions  Leadership 40%  With a Focus On Leadership, Mission, Vision, Culture, Strategy, Best Practices And Continuous Improvement, Performs The Following  Working in partnership with senior leadership, develops strategic alignment plan for the Advocacy Center's that supports and executes upon the National Strategic Plan. Leads and directs the Advocacy Center's resource planning and allocation for optimal capacity, utilization, and performance. Ensures that programmatic components, quality standards are enforced throughout the program, and compliance with all federal, state, local, and other applicable  regulatory and/or program requirements to include audit readiness.  Management 20%  In Collaboration With Leadership And Human Resources, Develops And Executes a Plan For Retaining And Developing Talent To Meet Current And Future Business Objectives To Include Engaging in talent review evaluations Collaborating with direct reports on their professional development and growth Assisting with developing leadership succession plans for the department Supervisory 20%  Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with Childhelp's cultural values and performance principles, company policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include: Actively participating in the interviewing and hiring processes and ensuring successful functional on-boarding of new employees Planning, assigning and directing work for direct reports Setting reasonable stretch performance goals, providing constructive, balanced, regular performance feedback & coaching, and conducting annual performance  appraisals Recognizing and rewarding performance excellence Communicating and enforcing company policies and programs Applying corrective action, addressing complaints and resolving problems in a timely fashion, involving and collaborating with leadership and Human Resources as appropriate.  Functional/Operational 20% Ensures implementation and continuous improvement of the Maricopa County Joint Investigative Protocol. Ensures effective implementation of best practice Represents Childhelp through speaking engagements, educational opportunities, and public appearances Collaborates with National Headquarters on donor stewardship, community outreach and awareness, sharing success stories, data and information that inspire others to  donate and join our mission Coordinates services with a multidisciplinary team, including law enforcement, CPS, medical staff, forensic interviewers, and other persons/groups related to child abuse  issues and ongoing cases, as necessary and appropriate within the forensic  environment Builds an environment conducive to collaboration to achieve the best investigative outcomes  Requirements Education/Experience/Knowledge/Understanding Master's degree (M.A.) or equivalent; or four to ten years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum of five years of related experience to include management Knowledge of child abuse neglect, at-risk youth and trauma Knowledge of the roles and responsibilities of Multi-disciplinary teams Skills Excellent verbal, written, and listening communication skills to include communicating clearly, effectively, tactfully, and patiently to a diverse population Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor with the ability to build rapport and garner trust with others Strong organizational, planning and time management skills Proficient in the use of a PC; in a Windows environment; in the use of the Internet; and in the use of MS Office Applications such as Outlook, Word and Excel  Abilities Ability to pass fingerprint background screening â€¢ Ability to understand and solve problems by applying intermediate analytical skills to include collecting all the relevant information and data needed to address the  problem; organizing, classifying and synthesizing the data into fundamental issues;  from the information, identifying the most probable causes of the problem; reducing  the information down into manageable components; identifying the logical outcomes  from the analyses of the data collected; and, identifying the options and solutions for  addressing the problems analyzed. Ability to lead, independently and collaboratively as part of a team Reliable transportation, ability to drive to and from training locations throughout Maricopa County Ability to work some evenings and weekends Ability and willingness to carry out the Childhelp mission and realize the Founders' vision by embodying the cultural values and performance principals of Acting with  Honor and Character; Being Open & Receptive; Caring About & Relating to Others;  Nurturing Diverse Relationships; Performance Excellence, and Inspirational Leading &  Managing  Physical Demands Ability to frequently see, hear, speak, and be physically flexible; occasionally sit, stand, walk, bend, run and drive; seldom stoop, climb carry, squat, kneel, push; and lift up to  30 lbs. Ability to withstand moderate noise levels Preferences Master's degree In Mental Health Counseling, Social Work

Milwaukee Data Science Tutor Jobs  The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Data Science tutors nationally and in Milwaukee. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.  Why join our platform? Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week. Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want. Set your own hours and schedule. Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients). Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform. Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus. We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session. What We Look For In a Tutor You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality. You can show subject-matter expertise in Data Science. You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student. Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform: 1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience. Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience. VT+ Classes: teach groups of 25-30 students anything from math fundamentals to video game design. Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time. School@Home: provide support for homeschooling parents with 1-on-1 Online Tutoring and Small Group Classes. Instant Tutoring: accept subject specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like. About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring  Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.  Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.

BMAS Agency are seeking a UK based Mid-Senior Full Stack React Developer to work as part of an existing team of skilled specialists focused on delivering bespoke cutting edge web solutions using the latest technologies. The role will require proficiency in both frontend and backend development. We are looking for a candidate that can work within existing development paradigms but equally confident to take ownership and drive these forward where needed. An ideal candidate will be comfortable working as a team but also solo when required. We are looking for a passionate individual who takes pride in their work and enjoys solving problems through creative ideation. BMAS is a full service digital agency that has grown from designing and building bespoke websites to offering complete digital solutions. Within our nine years of operating, we are well versed in a variety of brands and verticals, both corporate and consumer, concentrating our efforts on establishing, growing, and championing these companies in the digital space. Our client portfolio to date ranges through the fields of sports apparel, jewellery, fashion, media, contemporary art, fine-art photography and finance amongst many others. The development of our relationships across these sectors has helped us to affirm and cement the ever-growing digital footprint of BMAS Agency. Please visit our current website for an example of our clients. This is an ideal opportunity for someone with 3-5 years of experience in Web Development, and who is looking to make that next-step in their career. BMAS is an innovative, fast-paced and friendly environment, which will grant you the opportunity to work with the latest technology on projects for diverse and compelling brands. Our Engineering Culture Working as a single entity while promoting independent thinking. We value each other’s expertise and opinions. We’re ambitious for our clients' businesses, and for the users of the products we make for them. With an organisational structure that values listening over speaking we encourage the personal and professional growth of every person in the business. Our people are self-directing and our teams are self-organising. We are curious and willing to try new things. Periodic retrospectives are the cornerstone of continuous improvement. Peer lead code reviews and knowledge sharing are key to smooth organisational continuity. Two brains are better than one. Main Responsibilities Work with product owners to scope and spec and estimate technical requirements and architecture. Deliver functional solutions to complex problems. Work collaboratively with other teams/developers to ensure seamless delivery of projects. Develop new projects but also expand and maintain existing projects. Triage issues reported by the support team Maintain a high awareness of industry issues and trends, particularly as regards to accessibility, usability and emerging technologies. Collaborate with other employees to refine or develop approaches to common production issues Collaborate internally to develop agency development standards and tooling. Expand on existing testing and automation workflows. Oversight of security best practices and weaknesses and current implementations. Work closely with designers and developers in order to produce, modify and maintain high quality digital products of varying sizes and budgets. You will work across a range of clients in a variety of industry verticals. Collaborate with the design team to develop ideas and integrate designs seamlessly into chosen technologies. Train, inform and support other non-technical staff, particularly account managers and designers. Skills and Experience ESSENTIAL Minimum of 3-4 years experience Strong proficiency in Javascript and/or Typescript Strong proficiency in CSS React Next.js FRAMEWORKS React Next.js Styled Components / Emotion.js LANGUAGES Javascript / TS HTML SCSS GraphQL / Rest Node EXPERIENCE WITH Lambda or Edge Functions Headless Architecture GIT API's Data / Document Modelling / Architecture Figma Lottie Animations Ecommerce SERVICES Algolia Stripe Auth0 or Cognito, NextAuth - or similar Mailchimp SendGrid NPM Google Analytics CMS Sanity.io Dato CMS Contentful Similar CMS ECOMMERCE Shopify API - Headless Ecommerce (Not restrictive) Swell - Not restrictive Commerce Layer Other The role will be remote, but with hybrid options Hours: 9am – 5:30pm Hybrid Working, option to come into the WeWork, Victoria on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Free Beer. Work with the latest tech. Budget for training and personal development as a developer. Pension scheme A competitive salary depending on skills and experience Strong social scene, work drinks / dinners and events. 23 days annual leave public holidays Term of Employment: Permanent. Additional: Laptop provided. Application: Ensure you send your CV in PDF format. Please could we ask that recruiters and near/far shore development solutions not contact us about this role.

job_title: グローバル人事【日本最大のSIer】
company: 株式会社エヌ・ティ・ティ・データ
desc: 【仕事内容】  「グローバル人事【日本最大のSIer】」のポジションの求人です  ・海外グループ会社を対象としたグローバル共通人事施策の企画・運営（研修、組織開発など）  ・海外グループ会社の人事基礎情報の収集、分析  ・グループマネジメント協定に基づく、各種ガバナンス業務  【職務の魅力】  本部署は、担当は、世界50か国に及ぶ海外グループ会社を対象とした人事施策を統括し、人・組織の観点からNTT DATAの成長に貢献することをミッションとし、世界各国の人事リーダたちとの合同プロジェクトを数多く推進しています。またコーポレート本社部門の一組織として、人事領域のグローバルガバナスを担うミッションも有しています。担当業務を通じて、人事・人材育成に関する広範な業務スキルの獲得や、異文化プロジェクトチームのを率いるスキルや経験を高めることができます。  【採用背景】  グローバル人事統括本部 人事戦略担当は、主にM&Aで拡大してきた当社海外グループ会社を対象とした共通人事施策を数多く展開しています。その役割上、扱う人事領域は、採用から育成、制度、人事・報酬、組織開発、HR ITなど広範に及び、また世界各国の人事慣行と接しながら、グローバルな人事人材として成長できる職場です。  なかでも高度な業務である、海外幹部の人事・報酬ガバナンスには長期的観点での人材育成が必要ですが、相応の英語コミュニケーション力が求めれることもあり、社内の人事人材プールからの供給が十分ではありません。本求人には、５～１０年後にガバナンス業務を担える人材プールを拡大するという目的もあります。  買収した現地企業を対象とする業務であることから、いわゆる大企業で求められる人のつながりや社内の暗黙ルール理解といった要素の必要性は比較的少なく、転職されてきた方でも活躍しやすい職務となっています。海外へのコンタクトポイントとして国内各部から相談をうけることも多いので、社内人脈を築いていくこともできます。  グローバル人事統括部全体では、部長１名をはじめ、約1/3の方が転職してきて頂いた方で構成されています。  【求める人材】  【必須要件】  ■事業会社での人事・人材育成に関する業務経験  ■英語力（ミーティングやディスカッション時に使用）  【歓迎要件】  ・グローバル関連に関する実務経験  【給与】  年収 600 ～ 1400 万円  経験・スキルに応じて変動の可能性があります  【勤務地】  東京都  江東区豊洲3-3-3 豊洲センタービル  【勤務時間】  09:00～17:30  【雇用・契約形態】  【休日・休暇】  完全週休二日（土日）祝日、年末年始休暇、夏季休暇、年次有給休暇20日、特別休暇（慶弔ほか）、ライフプラン休暇、看護休暇など
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Internet Publishing

desc: Job Details  The future is being built today, and Johnson Controls is making that future more productive, more secure, and more sustainable. We are harnessing the power of cloud, data analytics, the Internet of Things, and user design thinking to deliver on the promise of intelligent buildings and smart cities that connect communities in ways that make people’s lives – and the world – better!  What You Will Do  In this career defining opportunity within the Global Product Security organization, you will drive design, development, integration, testing, adoption, and continuous improvement of common, contemporary, and modular cybersecurity components and shared software libraries that enhance capability, improve efficiency, and differentiate our products and services.  This includes driving continuous improvement initiatives aligned to our product security maturity framework, ensuring proactive management of security and data privacy risk across the full lifecycle of our products, platforms, and service offerings. In this role, you will play a pivotal role in managing cybersecurity risk and enabling customer success!  How You Will Do It You will coordinate with product leaders and functional teams across the company to guide adoption. Craft a standard set of cyber software and hardware components used across product lines. You will act as technical leader providing guidance on translating cybersecurity requirements and architectural design into software and hardware capabilities. Lead development of innovative cybersecurity prototypes and proofs of concept. Architect security and privacy by design and secure-by-default into software applications for mobile, embedded systems, and cloud. Evaluate utility and resiliency of cybersecurity components using integration and security assurance testing processes and capabilities. Review product architectures for security design gaps and vulnerabilities and consult with product teams to remediate or mitigate cyber risk. Support generation of intellectual property and submit patents to advance business objectives. Collaborate with business leaders and engineering directors on security risks and opportunities. Use Agile Project Management to manage resources and track milestones and deliverables. Support customer audits and inquiries pertaining to our product cybersecurity program. Identify cybersecurity opportunities that enhance the developer and customer experience. Speak at customer-facing events and present at conferences.  What We Look For You have developed products, and have practical product and software security experience, including secure SDLC practices, security, and privacy by design architectures, and secure by default configurations. You have solved cybersecurity issues and requirements (legal/regulatory, policy, customer, industry standards) and relate them to appropriate security controls. You lead change initiatives that intelligently manage software cyber risks. Tell us about delivering results using agile methodologies and tools (e.g., Scrum/Kanban, Jira). You have developed products Linux OS, programming, and scripting languages (e.g., Java, Python, Perl), and security tools (e.g., Kali, Nessus, Netsparker, openVAS, BurpSuite, Metaspolit). Your experience includes work on embedded systems architectures (e.g., ARM, Cortex), embedded systems tools/emulators, RTOS/Linux, network protocols and programming languages (such as C/C++). You have used TPM, Secure Boot, and, PKI, You have used hardware debugging with SPI/I2C bus analyzers, JTAG probing You have earned CSSLP, CISSP, CCSP, OSCP, CEH or related cybersecurity certifications. Familiarity with technology risk management related frameworks such as RMF, NIST 800-53, ISA/IEC 62443, UL CAP, ISO 27001, GDPR, CSL, CSA, SOC 2 and other comparable. Bachelor’s degree in Cybersecurity, Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related technical degree. At least 10 years’ experience in software or product cybersecurity including product development. Travel is occasional at approximately 10%, including international.  Preferred Active participation in hackathons, cybersecurity competitions, and exercises are a plus. Experience with Operational Technologies (e.g., Controls Systems, Building Management) a plus.  Where legally permissible, if hired, candidate is required to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19 no later than his/her start date, unless candidate has a valid medical condition or sincerely held religious belief precluding he/she from receiving the vaccine.  Johnson Controls International plc. is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a qualified individual with a disability or any other characteristic protected by law. To view more information about your equal opportunity and non-discrimination rights as a candidate, visit EEO is the Law. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please visit here.

job_title: Freelance medewerker GEO data (Geo cad tekenaar) (zzp)
desc: Sollicitatie deadline: 9-5-2022 8:30  Startdatum: 1-7-2022  Duur opdracht: 1 jaar  Aantal uren week: 32-36  Sollicitatiegesprekken met finalisten: 16 en 17 mei, bij voorkeur fysiek gaan plaatsvinden.  Medewerker Geo-data (Geo CAD tekenaar)  Het team Geo-data is o.a. verantwoordelijk voor het registreren en stroomlijnen van; landmeetkundige ondersteuning, GIS, cartografie, Basisregistratie Adressen en Gebouwen (BAG), Basisregistratie Grootschalige Topografie (BGT), Basisregistratie Ondergrond (BRO), naamgeving en huisnummering, het gemeentelijk Kadaster, nieuwbouw ketenproces, diverse geo gerelateerde kernregistraties. Deze registraties moeten voldoen aan kwaliteitseisen en landelijke wetgeving.  Wat ga je doen  In deze functie als medewerker Geo-data houd je je vooral bezig met de vervaardiging van diverse CAD tekeningen t.b.v. het nieuwbouwproces (matenplannen, grondtransactie etc). Met behulp van tools zoals Microstation Connect en Open Cities Map zet je de verschillende gegevens klaar. Je belangrijkste taak is het verzorgen van en zorgen voor het tijdig registreren en archiveren van gegevens conform de vastgestelde eisen. Hierbij werk je nauw samen via een geautomatiseerd systeem met de medewerkers binnen de organisatie.  Werkzaamheden Vervaardiging van uitzetveldwerken Landmeetkundige verwerking van bouwtekeningen en situatietekeningen Vervaardiging van matenplannen Vervaardiging van grondtransactie tekeningen Wie ben jij  Je hebt een MBO werk- en denkniveau met een sterke voorkeur op het gebied van Geo-Informatie en je staat open voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Je neemt graag initiatieven die ons verder brengen en stemt deze af. Je bent een communicatief vaardige teamplayer en hebt oog voor je collega’s.  Wat breng je mee brede kennis van (geo)basisregistraties; ervaring met CAD-tekenen (voorkeur Microstation Connect, Open Cities Map); affiniteit met Geo-Informatie; een sterk analytisch vermogen, je werkt zeer nauwkeurig; ervaring met digitale communicatie technieken (o.a. Microsoft-teams). de mogelijkheid om tijd- en plaatsonafhankelijk te werken. Meer over het team?  Bij team Geo-data werken we met veel passie en zien we elkaars kracht. Deze weten we optimaal te benutten om efficiënt en doelbewust ons werk te kunnen doen. Je hebt als medewerker een hoge eigen verantwoordelijkheid. Wij geloven dan ook in ondersteunend leiderschap, zodat medewerkers in hun kracht staan en excelleren. Team Geo-data is een onderdeel van de afdeling Stadsbedrijf. Wij geven bewoners, collega’s, ondernemers en partners van de gemeente Almere overzicht in een complexe omgeving waar veel gegevens beschikbaar zijn en elke dag meer gegevens bijkomen.  Wij geven gegevens een gezicht!

Are you interested in being part of an innovative team that supports Westinghouse's mission to provide clean energy solutions? At Westinghouse, we recognize that our employees are our most valuable asset and we seek to identify, attract and recruit the most qualified talent while recognizing and encouraging the value of diversity in the global workplace.  The Data Control System Administrator's primary area of responsibility will include support, administration, development services, and service delivery for the suite of Data Management applications. This individual will work closely with business and vendor resources to fully understand the needs and direction of the organization in the compliance space as it pertains to document management and control. Additional areas of responsibility will include participating in all levels of the software development lifecycle (including change management) and performing system and software administrator functions within the Data and Document Management organizations. This is a US ONLY Remote role.  Your Day To Day Provide Tier 2 & 3 Server and Client support for Data Control Systems, including Titus and NextLabs Maintain and implement configuration changes to the Data Management program according to Westinghouse change management policies and procedures Work with business and compliance entities to develop functional requirements and design documentation Create and maintain monitoring and reporting capabilities within suite of Data Management applications Collaborate with Application/Infrastructure/Compliance teams for adherence to best practices and process standardizations. Contribute to development and maintenance of core frameworks, APIs, and data structures Follow design best practices and implement regular deployments of application configuration while adhering to guidelines of system development lifecycles and agile development methodologies Understand and leverage new features of all underlying technologies; Recommend and implement emerging software solutions. Ability to develop and maintain collaborative relationships with peers and colleagues across the organization Ability to work well autonomously and within a team in a fast-paced and deadline-oriented environment while adhering to all necessary trade compliance and export control regulations Who You Are Bachelor's degree. Applicable disciplines are Information technology, Computer Science with knowledge of Data Management 2 Years System Administration and Software Development experience preferred but not required Experience with software development preferred General knowledge of REST API platforms General knowledge of Active Directory Service Change/Incident/Support management capabilities Working knowledge of Linux and/or Windows Operating Systems including scripting languages Proven troubleshooting and problem-solving skills for critical database, networking and system administration issues Ability to interface effectively and collaborate with clients, peers, and management to develop solutions Ability to handle diverse situations and rapidly changing priorities with deadlines Ability to fully document technical design and related project or systems-level documentation Why Westinghouse?  We Enable Our Delivery Of This Vision By Living Our Value System  Westinghouse Electric Company is the global nuclear energy industry's first choice for safe, clean, and efficient energy solutions. Safety and Quality Integrity and Trust Customer Focus and Innovation Speed and Passion to Win Teamwork and Accountability The Following Are Representative Of What We Offer  Westinghouse offers competitive benefits to all our employees around the globe to keep them healthy and enhance their well-being. job_title: Volunteer It Infrastructure Consultant for Art Works Projects
desc: ART WORKS Projects is seeking skilled volunteer support through Taproot Plus. Taproot Plus is an online platform that connects nonprofits to professionals seeking strong opportunities to volunteer their talent for good. All Taproot Plus projects are vetted and once ART WORKS Projects selects a volunteer applicant, Taproot Plus will provide resources and support to help make the project a success.  http://www.artworksprojects.org  About This Project  If you would like to learn more about this organization and project, please follow the apply link to schedule a preliminary call with a representative of the organization.  About This Organization  ART WORKS Projects’ mission is to use design and the arts to raise awareness of and educate the public about significant human rights issues. ART WORKS provides visual advocacy tools which produce action on human rights crises at the grassroots, media, and policy levels.  Conceptualized and created in conjunction with established humanitarian and human rights advocacy organizations, ART WORKS’ art and design exhibitions, books, recordings, films, and other initiatives provide opportunities for large numbers of the general population to engage in ending major human rights violations.  IT Infrastructure - IT Infrastructure development  ART WORKS Projects is small human rights advocacy organization that produces visual advocacy tools to activate change. We are a small team of remote/part-time staff and interns, but eager for operational efficiency/changes to take place in order for us to meet our goals. As we grow as an organization, we're seeking a volunteer consultant to come do an assessment on our existing IT infrastructure (or lack thereof) and to help identify solutions to ensure that we're running more smoothly in terms of project workflow, our ability to capture data, and are utilizing the tools available to us with improved efficiency and efficacy.  In particular, because we design documentary films and documentary photo exhibitions, we need someone who also has familiarity with media production tools and project management software to help move projects forward that involve internal/external stakeholders, but are still manageable for a small team of four.  What activities will be completed as part of the project: Align on organization’s mission, vision and strategic priorities Gather data from key stakeholders Review current business systems and processes Analyze and prioritize challenges and opportunities within technology Gather and document requirements for proposed solution (scope of work) Provide recommendations, and suggestions for implementation On the heels of our 15 year anniversary, AWP is at a critical time of growth. We've grown our team to four part-time team members and will continue to grow our staff as we just set-up our European office residency at The Hague. As the scale and scope of our projects grow, it is critical that our team can improve our workflow processes. With limited bandwidth and expertise on improving IT infrastructure, however, much of our work is still very manual and is starting to cause some strain on our team members.  Description  Description of what the deliverable will include and look like (deliverable)  This would be an exciting opportunity for a volunteer to come in and make great impact for an organization that is on a trajectory of growth, and also with an organization that gets to work on some really amazing visual storytelling projects with photographers, documentary filmmakers, and humanitarian air organizations across the globe. Discover deliverable: A brief that includes a summary of findings from the discovery process and a set of prioritized recommendations on how to move forward in addressing key challenges - the team has already worked through a number of items during a series of staff retreats at the start of the year that we can base these initial project scoping conversations off of. Design deliverable: A document that describes in detail what solution or solutions the organization will need to implement in order to move toward their desired state. This should be focused on prioritized solutions and not include solutions to more than two identified challenges. The document should essentially be a scope of work and aligning project implementation plan with a: a project description , an estimated time-frame for completing the project , the resources needed to complete the project successfully, including the type of talent or skills needed. This project can be done remotely.

Direct message the job poster from Mia Burton Michela Pau People Manager | Licensed NLP Coach | Podcaster Mia Burton is looking for a Back-End Developer to join our tight-knit digital team and help us bring our ecosystem of e-commerce and inventory management solutions to the next level.  We can't wait to meet a versatile person, who will support our project managers by curiously and accurately supervising all technical details, from the server-side web application logic to the integration of the front-end part.   What we offer  A challenging career path in a fast-paced company that is growing rapidly, thanks to its unshakable ambition. A young and stimulating work environment that values humanity and individuality. A competitive salary, which remunerates autonomy, proactivity, flexibility, practicality, mediation and problem solving as hard skills. Internal continuous learning initiatives and a dedicated budget for acquiring specialist and transversal knowledge. Flexible mindset and working hours. Ping pong and billiards tournaments, no-holds-barred. Beer, soft drinks and snacks for improvised happy hours at the office.  What you'll be in charge of   You will help us launch, grow and maintain our platforms at every stage of their life cycle, designing and developing scalable web applications for:  miaburton.com, our e-commerce platform specialized in fashion eyewear Mia Burton Distribution, a recently launched B2B e-commerce platform for eyewear retailers Mia Management, our proprietary inventory management platform.    In addition, you will contribute automating business processes through API integration of our platforms with third-party systems.   To help the whole company make faster and better decisions, you will develop data warehouse solutions that will support our Business Intelligence needs.   Last but not least, you will take part in our Research and Development projects, experimenting with new software technologies to help us reach our business goals.   Must-have experience and skills  At least 2 years of experience as a back-end developer Good knowledge of Go and/or Node.js Experience with the most diffused relational and non-relational databases (MySql, MongoDB) Great attention to the quality of code, performances and security Knowledge of versioning tools like Git, SVN (Subversion), Mercurial or similar Ability to quickly learn new coding languages and technologies Knowledge of Unix systems Advanced Italian skills Good English skills  What would win our heart  Experience in automation testing Knowledge of the most diffused software architecture and design patterns Experience with Docker Knowledge of Agile/Scrum techniques  Type of contract  Permanent, full-time employment, remote

job_title: Infrastructure Engineer | £55,000 + Bonus + Package | FinTech | Hybrid working 3 days remote, 2 days Leeds office
desc: Infrastructure Engineer | £55,000 + Bonus + Package | FinTech | Hybrid working 3 days remote, 2 days Leeds officeInfrastructure engineer required for a Fintech, who specialise in building Digital Wealth Management platforms. With the aim of becoming the UK’s #1 digital financial planning business by 2026.The FinTech are building a Greenfield infrastructure environment through a number of strategic transformational initiatives including the provision of a new digital workplace environment. This infrastructure engineer role is paying up to £55,000 + bonus + Benefits.The firm adopt a hybrid model in terms of working. 2-3 days a week from home and 2 days from the office.The Infrastructure engineer role sit in the Workplace Technology function, who are responsible for the development and support of infrastructure, colleague environment and collaboration technologies. Key to the firms success is the new modern digital workplace proposition and they are looking for Infrastructure engineers with varying levels of experience to assist with its development. These Infrastructure engineers will be hands on and will be working as part of an engineering team developing and implementing the components that will make up the overall proposition.Responsibilities of the Infrastructure team include:Device, Application & Data ManagementCollaboration & Unified Comms (Voice, Video, SharePoint, Email)Office Engineering (Telemetry, Add On management & governance)Process Automation (Azure Automation and Power Automate)Active Directory/Identity & Access Mgt Cloud (SaaS, PaaS, IoT)Networks (WAN, LAN and WiFi) The firm are looking for Infrastructure engineers with varying levels of experience across a number of the following areas :MS365 Product Suite (Previously Office 365 - Including but not limited to MS Teams, Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, OneDrive for Business) Azure Active Directory Process Automation, scripting / coding (Including but not limited to PowerShell, PowerApps, GraphAPI, Python)Experience with the Jira and Confluence toolsetsExperience with CMS systems including a knowledge of HTMLExperience using APIs for data gatheringIf you are interested in this infrastructure engineer role, please reply with your CV or send to ross@virtuetech.io

job_title: Infosec & Data Governance, Risk and Compliance Analyst
desc: Location: Isle of Man  About Huddle: Huddle is a software partner for gaming operators of all sizes in regulated markets around the world.  We love sports and technology. So, we build software that makes a real impact for ambitious gaming operators, solutions that will help our partners thrive in a rapidly expanding global gaming landscape.  Staying ahead of the competition and on top of regulation is hard for gaming operators, we build solutions that will help them grow their businesses, lower costs, and operate effectively in multiple jurisdictions. All while delivering a better experience to customers.  About the role: As the Infosec & Data Governance, Risk and Compliance Analyst you will work closely with the Manager for the area shaping the ISMS, including and IS027001 compliant set of policies and standards that you will own areas of, and work with your manager and other internal and external stakeholders, ensuring quality and management in relation to sensitive data and information assets.  You will work with operational security and compliance teams to identify improvements in current systems, processes and controls. The scope of this information will include personal information and company information. You will be working with a variety of privacy laws such as GDPR and will assist in aligning business practices with ISO27001 and GLI 19 standards. You will work with your manager on licensing, certification and auditing processes.  Basic Qualifications: Experience in a data compliance / information security focused position.  Experience in applying and/or reviewing effective processes and controls to comply with industry standards.  Knowledge of different tech domains (network, endpoints, cloud), and IT security concepts.  Experience within the gambling or other regulated industry.  Preferred qualifications: Ability to write reports and present complicated concepts in a clear and intuitive way.  Knowledge of information management and data protection laws (DPA, GDPR), regulations and best practices.

Your mission  At the heart of the Blickfeld LiDAR sensor, there is a highly optimized piece of software. It's this software that puts life into our sensor: controlling the beam deflection units, orchestrating the range measurements, filtering and post-processing data. In the end, the Blickfeld LiDAR produces accurate 3D data that enables cars, drones, and AGVs to perceive the environment. In your role as Embedded Software Engineer at Blickfeld, you work on some of the toughest technical challenges of our times, and you love it! You enjoy a creative working atmosphere and a “can do” attitude. With your help, our lidar sensors will eventually be paving the way to autonomous driving!  Your tasks  ⟋ Develop Software for high-performance lidar sensors  ⟋ Write embedded C/C++ code to run on heterogeneous platforms – from microcontroller to PC  ⟋ Develop and implement new algorithms that further improve our sensor performance  ⟋ Closely collaborate with other technical disciplines, such as electrical engineers and FPGA designers  ⟋ Derive software requirements and a software architecture from system requirements  ⟋ Employ tools and infrastructure to ensure highest code quality, by applying best practices such as continuous integration, unit testing, and static code analysis  Your profile  ⟋ You have a Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Embedded Systems or equivalent  ⟋ You have first relevant industry working experience  ⟋ You are an expert in modern C/C++ programming, and you have experience with libraries such as asio and boost.  ⟋ You have excellent command of Python, git, CMake and other typical development tools  ⟋ You are comfortable with low-level embedded C programming  ⟋ Ideally, you are familiar with embedded operation systems such as Yocto Linux  ⟋ Ideally, you have experience with software development in regulated environments, such as automotive, and know about relevant standards such as Automotive SPICE and ISO 26262  Why Blickfeld?  ⟋ Enjoy free beverages and lunch allowance  ⟋ Work in a dynamic environment with quick development cycles and flat hierarchies  ⟋ Develop ideas and realize them  ⟋ Be part of a great team, that lives and breathes technology  ⟋ Make the future of mobility a reality today  ⟋ We are one team – everybody pitches in  ⟋ “Can do” attitude  ⟋ Courage to act and to make decisions  ⟋ Things can go wrong, that’s ok  ⟋ Friendly and constructive behavior  ⟋ We stick together and can rely on each other  Contact  We are looking forward to your application, including your CV, certificates/diplomas and a short cover letter.  Contact person: Florian Lenz ⟋ career@blickfeld.com

job_title: Data Center Physical Migration, Project Manager
desc: IT Project Management . Dallas, Texas  Why Align  For over three decades , many of the world's leading firms have relied on Align as a tru sted IT solution provider and center of excellence in IT advisory, infrastructure design , build , delivery and managed services . We are actively seeking innovative minds to establish and strengthen our team to deliver high-quality state-of-the-art technology solutions for our enterprise and boutique clients.  If you are seek ing to lead challenging projects for some of today's most fascinating companies while leveraging an exceptional team and long track record of success , then we want to hear from you today .  Position Overview  Align seeks an experience Data Center Migration Project Managerwith proven expertise managing physical data center migration and consolidation projects. Most current and upcoming projects in our Dallas, TX office will focus on physical server migrations (Lift and Shift) but other upcoming projects will include infrastructure transformation including more application, workload, and cloud migrations. The person we hire will have the opportunity to develop their skills in these areas as well. Qualified individuals must have recent enterprise-level physical data center relocation experience with strong communications skills. The current focus is being a hands on project manager for physical data center migrations. Qualified individuals will be working in fast-paced enterprise-level environments. This is a highly visible role that will have constan t interaction with key clients. This role will m anage complex projects to plan, schedule and execute projects for various-sized enterprise clients (infrastructure, storage, network, server and IT appliances, etc.) . Most current projects are in Texas, but approximately 30% travel will be required at times. This role is based out of our Dallas, Texas office . S ome travel may be required, which we estimate would be around 30% or more at times. This is a full-time position offering full benefits, a competitive salary, paid training and performance-based bonuses .  Responsibilities  Manage the project teams including; Align, the client and the vendors throughout the data center relocation or physical server migration project Be a hands-on owner of a project that is willing to be hands on to ensure moves go smoothly Assist with troubleshooting as needed and be willing to "roll up your sleeves" Manage all migration plans and wave event planning (i.e., run books, execution plans) Oversee and participate in data center inventory Gather documentation, review dependencies, and b uild and develop a delivery plan for all the work streams Advise clients on potential risk, and manage client expectations Manage multiple Wave Leads on larger migrations or act as a Wave Lead on smaller migrations Manage the process with an deep understanding of risk mitigation and chain of custody for physical servers Execute change controls, quality, risk management and communications throughout the project Overall project monitoring, budget and corrective action management Author all project status reports and dashboards, meeting agendas and minutes, and executive reports and presentations as needed Learn about and help participate in technology infrastructure transformation projects , " current state to future state ", with a focus on data center infrastructure transformation Assist with creation of Statements of Work and support the sales process as needed Continually improve the process and framework and update our migration solution  Qualifications  Minimum of 5 years relevant experience with a focus on Physical Data Center Migration / Data Center Lift and Shift Project Management Must be a hands on leader that is willing to "roll up their sleeves" to ensure server moves go smoothly Must have prior experience managing one or more complex, enterprise-level physical data center migration or consolidation projects (Server Lift and Shift Move) Solid project management skills with the ability to create and manage budgets, project schedules and dependencies (Microsoft Project) Able to apply an understanding of data center functions, technologies and interdependencies to create effective migrations plans, move schedules and minimize risks A holistic understanding of IT infrastructure inclusive of s erver, storage, netwo rk, database, systems , DR/business recovery and continuity practices, etc. Understanding of Asset Management, Data Center Inventory, Application Discovery and/or Dependency Mapping (experience with tools/process) Understand application and workload move dispositions (P2V, V2V, P2P, Lift and Shift) and the methodologies around each F amiliar with application and workload dependencies , architecture and service level requirements Excellent communication, organization and writing skills are required MS Project, PowerPoint, Visio and Office tools to manage plans, charts, reports and documentation, etc. Any IT transformation project experience ( assessments, migrations, consolidations, virtualization projects, etc. ) would be a plus A foundational understanding of public cloud models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) and providers (AWS, Azure, Google) is a plus PMP certification is a plus Must be able to travel as needed Bachelor's degree preferred In summary, w e seek a smart, energetic professional who is a self-starter and has a proven track record of finding an d delivering IT programs o f work, while managing teams in a fast-paced, challenging environment!  About Align  Align is a dynamic and flexible place to work, offering professionals unparalleled opportunities to train in the leading technologies, make an impact within the industry and control their own destinies. We have a flawless track record of delivering technical solution s and have established long-standing relationships with an impressive client list of both Global 1000 and SMB clients.  We work across a diverse list of industries including financial services, life sciences (pharmaceutical and health care), retail, technology, media and telecommunications. We give our professionals the autonomy to pursue opportunities and manage assignments in ways that maximize their creativity and talents, leading to self-fulfillment and financial rewards.  For more details, visit www.align.com .  PM20  Tier 2

desc: Direct message the job poster from Contrado Heena Vaghela Talent Hunter Hello  Greetings from Contrado. You will help ensure our applications remain highly available, performing under increased load and grow in line with business objectives  Principle Accountabilities and Responsibilities ·        Strategic planning for growth of our applications to handle high traffic/load ·        Continuously plan & execute refactoring and maintainability of healthy codebase ·        Actively contribute to learning & development initiatives to train software delivery teams on best practices. ·        Work with Technical Project Managers in designing and delivering high quality software ·        To be the escalation point for all technical issues  What you'll need to succeed Minimum 12 years’ experience designing and building software applications At least 3 years’ experience designing software architectures using Object Oriented principles Strong knowledge of software & cloud design patterns Solid experience of leading and delivering successful modern, highly available, high-quality, high-performance architectures using Microsoft and Open-source technologies Solid experience with distributed software design such as Microservices, Domain Driven Design and Event Sourcing Expert in C#, NET Framework, .NET Core, ASP.NET (Core), MVC, Web API Experience working with front-end frameworks, like Angular, React Solid experience on using ORM's such as NHibernate or Entity Framework Solid experience with distributed cache as Memcache, Redis Experience in Message Queues such as Kafka, Amazon SQS, RabbitMQ Experience with using SQL & NoSQL data stores, like SQL Server, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Elastic Search Strong experience with Amazon Web Services or another Cloud Platform Experience with developing consumer facing cross-platform web applications. job_title: テクノロジーコンサルタント Corporate DX※M以上
company: ＥＹストラテジー・アンド・コンサルティング株式会社
desc: 【仕事内容】  「テクノロジーコンサルタント Corporate DX※M以上」のポジションの求人です  EY では Building a Better Working World「より良い社会の構築を目指して」というPurpose のもと、 変革のリーダーとしてお客様のビジネス変革のお手伝いをし、長期的な価値を提供しています。  変革には Business Transformation だけでなく Technology Transformation も必要不可欠であり、Technology Consulting 組織では「Technology＠Speed」として Cloud, IoT, Blockchain, AI, Security など様々な Technology を活用しAgile そして Data driven なコンサルティング活動を推進しています。  今回募集する Microsoft ソリューションを担当するテクノロジーコンサルタント（Corporate DX）は、マイクロソフト・テクノロジーを活用し、DX内製化の「実践」と、DX内製化を促進する「組織・人・プロセスの変革」を支援します。これにより、クライアントが進めるコーポレート・レベルのデジタル・トランスフォーメーションの実現を支援し、企業が取り組む社会課題と企業課題の解決を促進します。  なかでも、デジタル・テクノロジーによる支援が広がりをみせ、かつマイクロソフトテクノロジーの導入ニーズが広がっています人的資本投資の領域で、従業員の生産性向上を目的とした従業員エンゲージメント向上を実現する従業員エクスペリエンス・デザイン支援サービスを推進していただきます。  また、EY Experience for Microsoft Solutionsプログラムを通して、クライアントへDXの実践と推進の体験を提供いただきます。  この職務を通して、マイクロソフト・テクノロジーに関する技術や知見を活かした提案活動から、デジタル・テクノロジーの動向や最新事例の調査、問題定義、ソリューションの設計・開発・導入、効果検証、変革の促進まで、幅広い分野でご活躍いただけます  【求める人材】  【必須要件】  ■3年以上の業務システム提案・設計・開発・導入の経験  ■3年以上のクラウドサービスを活用したアプリケーション開発またはインフラ開発の経験  【歓迎要件】  ・DXのドライバーとなるCloud Platform、Emerging Technologyの動向に対する深い知識と提案経験  ・DXの主要領域に対する深い知識と提案経験  ・従業員エンパワーメント  ・顧客エンゲージメント  ・プロセスの最適化  ・製品サービスとビジネスモデルの変革  ・DXの内製化や組織・人・プロセスの変革に関する深い知識と提案経験  【給与】  年収 1000 ～ 1800 万円  ※ご本人の能力、経歴、前職年収等を総合的に考慮の上、決定いたします。  なお、経験・スキルに応じて変動の可能性があります  【勤務地】  東京都  千代田区有楽町一丁目1番2号 東京ミッドタウン日比谷 日比谷三井タワー  【勤務時間】  09:30～17:30  【雇用・契約形態】  【休日・休暇】  完全週休二日（土日）祝日、年末年始休暇、有給休暇、慶弔休暇、創立記念日休暇、その他

NIAD/QStaffing/Pearl Australia is looking to hire "Data Engineers (multiple)" for our federal government client "Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources". Please find the details below:  Location of work: Australian Capital Territory, New South Wales, Northern Territory, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania, Victoria, Western Australia Length of contract: 12 months Contract extensions: 2 x 12 months Security clearance: Ability to obtain baseline clearance  The Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources (DISER) strives to encourage the sustainable growth of Australian industries including the delivery of a national innovation system to drive knowledge creation, international competitiveness and greater productivity. Our staff are committed to developing policies and delivering programs, in partnership with stakeholders, to provide lasting economic benefits based on principles of social justice and equity for all Australians.  The CIO Group provides a range of enabling services and operations delivery to the department and to Australian businesses and are seeking experienced and motivated testers to assist with testing of various ICT Projects across the Division. Projects will comprise of implementing an enhanced data management and analytics platform to facilitate data warehousing capabilities, reporting, data analysis, storing transactional data and archiving of required data.  Data Engineers will be required to: • work closely with various stakeholders, business subject matter experts, technical architects, cloud engineers and developers as part of the project, to deliver the agreed project outcomes. • define data solutions using Azure Synapse, Azure Managed Instance and work with DISER’s data platform team to deliver these solutions • Assist in the migration of existing data processes (Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services) to the new data platform (Azure Synapse) • Have the ability to understand DevOps process and can use DevOps tools in accordance with the agreed processes • Develop and maintain relevant project and design documentation such as detailed designs, technical configuration documents and build guides • Work with DISER’s data platform team to consume and implement recommended practices to ensure compliance of data and information management standards • Be able to apply judgement and critical thinking skills to problem solve • Have demonstrated government sector experience, including working in small project teams • Previous experience with Microsoft technologies, specifically Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Managed Instance and Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is required. • Experience in working within an Agile team is highly desirable, and experience working in an enterprise data warehouse is desirable. • Relevant qualifications and demonstrated experience in information technology, data management, or related fields would be highly regarded, including the ability to communicate data concepts to generalist audiences.  Essential Skills: Proven experience with Microsoft stack technologies, specifically SQL Managed Instance, Azure Synapse, Azure Data Factory, Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services High level of competency with SQL programming Proven ability to engage and work with a diverse range of stakeholders including working collaboratively as part of an agile, multidisciplinary team Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience in developing and maintaining relevant documentation such as detailed designs, technical configuration documents and build guides  Desirable Skills: Experience with Agile methodologies Experience with Microsoft Power BI Experience with delivering solutions using a data warehouse platform and processes Cultural fit: • Ability to work in a fast paced, agile, environment • Work collaboratively as a team within the organisation to deliver quality outcomes • Communicate honestly, clearly, proactively and consistently Cultural fit: • Ability to pragmatically change direction and scope as new information is discovered and challenges or opportunities present themselves • Ability to work with geographically dispersed teams • Ability to work with technical and non-technical staff at all levels  If Interested and looking for a change, Please email us at Sheenam@NIAD.com.au or call us at 0251110511 for a confidential discussion on the same.  Regards, Talent Acquisition Team NIAD Australia and Pearl Australia https://niad.com.au/ https://www.qstaff.com.au/

job_title: Entry Level Autonomous Vehicle Trainer | Immediate Openings
desc: Description:* AV Test Operator About the role: Would you like to work with ground-breaking technology? Are you as comfortable behind the wheel as you are with a computer? As an AV Test Operator, you will help us test and improve the performance of our driverless cars. You will tackle hard problems that have immediate and valuable real-world applications. You should have strong attention to detail, basic technical skills, and an excellent driving record. Integrity, good judgment, and the ability to work in a team environment are required at all times. You will be expected to keep certain project details confidential. Day-to-day responsibilities include: Work in teams, alternating (i) driving (some manual driving but primarily monitoring the vehicle's behavior in autonomous mode and taking over when necessary) and (ii) software monitoring and logging responsibilities and providing verbal feedback/directions about the AVs environment. Complete timely and detailed ride reports for our operations and engineering teams Participate in the ongoing training of new AV Test Operators Test other aspects of our robot cars Perform ad hoc projects as needed Requirements: Licensed to drive a motor vehicle in the U.S. for the three years immediately preceding your application and currently hold an active California Basic Class C driver's license or license encompassing Class C vehicles. No more than one point on driving record and excellent driving skills Must be willing to submit background check and drug screen Ability to drive and/or spend time sitting in a car for 6-8 hours/day Ability to give and receive clear, prompt, understandable verbal and written communication Ability to accurately type and read on a laptop in a moving vehicle Ability to safely operate the vehicle in accordance with Cruise safety protocols and applicable law. This includes, but is not limited to, having a sufficient range of motion to turn a steering wheel, safely operating the accelerator and brake, checking blind spots and evaluating the environment, and maintaining appropriate air bag clearance. Ability to tolerate physical jolts and high speed starts, stops, turns, and maneuvers associated with driving or taking control of the autonomous vehicle in both training and daily job functions Ability to perform physical work including, but not limited to, bending, stooping, and various operational tasks Ability to work effectively and professionally in a stressful environment, including interactions with the public Ability to remain alert and extremely focused for two-hour uninterrupted blocks of time Ability to walk up and down flights of stairs Ability to satisfy the legal requirements to become an AV Test Operator (13 CCR 227.34) Work hours: 40 hours per week, five consecutive days, 8-hour shifts Multiple shift times available Swing: 3:30PM - 11:30PM* Overnight: 11:30PM-7:30AM* Top Skills Details:* Typing, Quality Assurance , Data Collection, Driving Additional Skills & Qualifications:* Typing Ability - 25WPM minimum Clean Drivers' Record - no more than1 point on current drivers' license, 3 year continuous driving record Experience Level:* Entry Level (C)  About Actalent:  Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

job_title: Backend Web Developer Node.js TypeScript - Tech for Good
desc: Backend Web Developer / Software Engineer (Node.js TypeScript) *Remote UK*. Tech for Good company that is enabling life changing education to be accessed by students around the world is seeking a skilled Backend Developer with Node.js and TypeScript experience.As a Backend Web Developer you will design and develop large, distributed, scalable systems working within a modern cloud (AWS) microservices based environment; you'll be predominately using Node.js and TypeScript but will also gain exposure to Kafka, Scala, Docker, Kubernetes and AWS. The company are passionate about providing excellent education to hundreds of thousands of students around the world and support a number of causes and cutting edge research projects that improve the way people learn via real-time, live streaming technology as well as Video on Demand. There's a remote interview and onboarding process as well as the ability to work from home fulltime from anywhere in the UK (or you can do a hybrid model at the office in London if preferred). Requirements:*You have backend development experience using Node.js and TypeScript *You have a good knowledge of APIs and data / streaming technologies (e.g. Kafka, Databricks, Spark)*You understand CI/CD pipelines and how to deploy to the cloud*You're collaborative with Agile team experience As a Backend Web Developer / Software Engineer you will earn a competitive salary (to £110k) plus benefits. Apply now or call to find out more about this Backend Web Developer / Software Engineer (Node.js TypeScript) opportunity.

Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.  We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.  Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.  Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity  Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.  At Rogers, your journey is fill ed with limitless possibilities - let’s make your dream co-op placement possible.  About The Team  If you have always wanted to work at an entrepreneurial company where the employees are committed to solving big challenges and making a real difference; then join Rogers. We are a leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. We are looking for individuals who are curious, love to contribute to our technology strategy and want to be part of our high performing and technologically driven team.  For our Summer 2022 term, we are seeking individuals for Business Systems Analyst coop role that will be the part of our consumer IT and Enterprise Data & Analytics teams. Our interns will get exposure to different technologies and products while collaborating with cross functional teams for technology transformation projects, driving modern software engineering, optimizing processes to facilitate reusability and streamlining the development of the analytical solutions.  What You Will Do… Assist the team with facilitating collaborative sessions with diverse business stakeholder groups to drive requirements discovery, impact analysis, identify influencer groups, reviewing and prioritizing and make recommendations to satisfy business needs. Participate in various Agile ceremonies, alongside the platform/product owner, and collaborate with cross-functional teams including, enterprise architecture, engineering, and finance in conducting research and fulfilling the needs of your portfolio. Assist in writing and developing user stories, financial analysis, business cases, user acceptance test plan, define associated investments with rogers, strategies and leading the overall testing activities for medium to large initiatives. You will conduct research into new improved processes within the technology areas. Technical topics of study may include topics such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Cloud Native Development, Customer 360, Order Management, etc. You will create and pitch strategy documents which include defining a problem statement, completing quantitative and qualitative analysis, and making innovative recommendations in a concise and compelling manner Define new IT capabilities and collaborate with the team to provide ongoing requirements/build/testing support to the developers and QA team What You Will Bring… Enrolled in an accredited co-op program working towards a degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Business Technology Management or equivalent. Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel and PowerPoint) is required. Experience with SharePoint, Service Now, JIRA and Confluence applications can be considered as an asset. Knowledge of API’s /Microservices Architecture, AWS Cloud Architecture, UML Diagrams Use case diagrams, Activity Diagrams, Business process Model, and Notation, prototypes, wireframes using Microsoft Visio and Lucid Chart can be considered as an asset. Strong Communication skills (written and oral) and Interpersonal skills required; A self starter with strong sense of presence - confident and comfortable working with senior management Strong ability to multitask by applying different time management techniques. A strong team player comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed Here’s What You Can Expect In Return A team who deeply cares about your development and long term career at Rogers A team that trusts and wants to win together A competitive salary Access to leading edge technology and services so we can make more possible for our customers and our business every day. A campus team that will keep you engaged through onboarding and your work term As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.  Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]  Shift Day  Length of Contract 4 Months  Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON  Travel Requirements None  Posting Category/Function Student/New Grad & Co-op  Requisition ID 268566  At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https//digital.rogers.com/  Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work Our people are at the heart of our success Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do We do what’s right, each and every day We believe in the power of new ideas We work as one team, with one vision We give back to our communities and protect our environment Posting Notes Student and New Grad

This position is responsible for the early stage management of design for assigned transmission line and substation projects. The Project Engineering Lead works in the Engineering & Construction (E&C) Group and is responsible for transmission line and HV substation projects from conception (Early Stage) through turnover to the execution team; typically, at a 30‐60% design completion level. In the conceptual phase, the Project Engineering Lead works with the Early Stage Project Manager to define and influence the project requirements and scope with NextEra Energy Transmission Development Group. Projects can begin as FERC 1000 competitive transmission project proposals, or as greenfield projects for NEET affiliates (Lone Star, GridLiance, NEETNY, etc.). The Project Engineering Lead shall secure engineering consulting resources when required from a list of approved suppliers by developing a scope of work, securing bids, evaluating, and awarding work through NEER’s Integrated Supply Chain (ISC) Group. A critical performance requirement is the ability to direct consultant’s activities, conduct design reviews/optimize designs, develop design requirements document, define RFP deliverables, and manage all work to the prescribed deadlines. The Project Engineering Lead must coordinate with other project stakeholders to identify and develop a transmission line route, suitable substation site, support the engineering data, and permits necessary to design and develop the project, including geotechnical and lidar data. Activities include competitively sourcing, selecting and contracting geotechnical, survey, engineering, and construction services, and supporting the E&C Cost Estimating Team with scope assumptions. The position is responsible for coordinating the engineering deliverables in support of NEET’s FERC Order 1000 competitive request for proposals (RFP). Deliverables include scope of work documents, proposal technical content, RFPs for engineering services, input to presentations for management review, and vetting of technical solution against cost estimate assumptions. Employee in this role will support early stage design for assigned projects by reviewing EOR drawings and organizing design reviews, technical specifications for major equipment, bid evaluations and contract oversight, and general problem solving. Work with Early Stage Project Manager to define RFP schedule and deliverables, as well as the schedule for engineering activities and associated logic for the execution phase of the project. Prepares engineering turnover documentation and holds meeting to transfer project materials and knowledge to execution team; continues to support execution team during transition period. * * *Required* Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Mechanical or Civil/Structural Engineering. Minimum of 7 years of experience in the development, design, engineering, and construction of high voltage transmission line and substation projects. The ideal candidate must have a strong knowledge of both transmission and substation design Supporting FERC Order 1000 RFPs will require candidate to demonstrate adaptability to a dynamic environment with projects often characterized by rapidly evolving technical solutions, changing priorities, and tight deadlines. * * *Preferred* Project Engineering and/or Project Management experience with a strong bias for action. PMP and/or P.E. in related discipline is a plus. Proficiency with standard industry tools such as PLSCADD, Auto‐CAD, Primavera and other software is strongly desired. Description:* Spark GTIC (Gene Therapy Innovation Center) projects is a large $575+Mil Gene Therapy manufacturing building in Philadelphia.  Must Haves: 15+ years of experience in construction industry Experience in Biopharmaceutical or Pharmaceutical construction Experience on construction projects valued at $200 million or more Osha 10 at a minimum, Osha 30 preferred ** Any experience with Primavera is also a bonus ** Bachelors degree in Construction management or engineering is desired Client Description:* They are looking to bring a Experienced Construction Management Professional on board for the next 5-6 years on a contract basis to support this large Capital Project. As a Construction Management Professional, you’ll join the collaborative GTIC team supporting our safety culture while planning, engineering, architectural design, and construction management in support of the Spark team and the Jacobs CM team (who have been contracted as CM for this project). We are looking for a passionate Construction Professional for our project in Philadelphia Pa who is driven by collaboration, exceeding expectations, and challenging the status quo.  Through supporting and delivering on project safety, construction scopes, budgets, reports, contracts, and schedules, you’ll help our teams achieve our goals/objectives. Your ability to multi-task, communicate effectively and tackle project challenges will allow you to thrive in our fast-paced environment.  Your responsibilities will include leading the safety program, providing Construction Management support/oversight for the construction of Spark’s GTIC facility in Philadelphia PA. Your role will be to champion the safe and environmentally sound delivery of this project from a construction perspective. Help to conduct or assist with pre-construction conferences, participate in subcontractor bid processes, Support Jacobs in the Management of field staff that may include inspectors, resident engineers, and administrative personnel, support site meetings dealing with Contractor work progress, schedule, coordination, record drawing as well as problem exposure and resolution meetings.  The Construction Manager will support the schedule of surveyors and testing laboratories as necessary, may negotiate and resolve Change Order Requests and Request for Quotes, proposals on behalf of Spark.  Support and control processes for testing and collecting TOP data to support commissioning and validation. Essentially, this leadership position helps to deliver the full project lifecycle from support of sales through facility qualification. Employee Value Proposition (EVP)* One of the fasted growing Gene Therapy companies in Philadelphia. This is one of the highest profile projects in the city from a size and dollar value currently. This is guaranteed work for 5-6 years. Work Environment* This is an on site and in office position. University City, Philadelphia is the site Engineering office is Conshohocken at Jacobs Engineering when necessary  About Actalent:  Actalent connects passion with purpose.
