Job Description:  Responsible for designing and developing complex requirements to accomplish business goals. Ensures that software is developed to meet functional, non-functional, and compliance requirements. Ensures solutions are well designed with maintainability/ease of integration and testing built-in from the outset. Possess strong proficiency in development and testing practices common to the industry, and have extensive experience of using design and architectural patterns. At this level, specializations start to form in either Architecture, Test Engineering or DevOp. Contributes to story refinement/defining requirements. Participates and guides team in estimating work necessary to realize a story/requirement through the delivery lifecycle. Performs spike/proof of concept as necessary to mitigate risk or implement new ideas. Codes solutions and unit tests to deliver a requirement/story per the defined acceptance criteria and compliance requirements. Utilizes multiple architectural components (across data, application, business) in design and development of client requirements. Assists team with resolving technical complexities involved in realizing story work. Designs/develops/modifies architecture components, application interfaces, and solution enablers while ensuring principal architecture integrity is maintained. Designs/develops/maintains automated test suites (integration, regression, performance). Sets up and develops a continuous integration/continuous delivery pipeline. Automates manual release activities. Mentors other Software Engineers and coaches team on CI-CD practices and automating tool stack. Individual contributor.  Enterprise Risk & Finance Technology (ERFT) at Bank of America Believes diversity makes us stronger so we can reflect, connect and meet the diverse needs of our clients and employees around the world. Is committed to building a workplace where every employee is welcomed and given the support and resources to perform their jobs successfully. Wants to be a great place for people to work and strives to create an environment where all employees have the opportunity to achieve their goals. Provides continuous training and development opportunities to help employees achieve their career goals, whatever their background or experience. Is committed to advancing our tools, technology, and ways of working to better serve our clients and their evolving business needs. Believes in responsible growth and is dedicated to supporting our communities by connecting them to the lending, investing and giving them what they need to remain vibrant and vital. Who We Look For:  Bank of America’s associates are innovators and problem-solvers. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment. The Enterprise Independent testing team within Risk and Finance Technology consists of extremely talented architectures, who develop industry leading financial management platforms that provide solutions to perform Compliance and Process testing globally.  We are looking for looking for a talented and highly motivated Experienced Data Architecture leader for Enterprise wide program includes several independent/related projects which require interactions with Business leadership and strong technical background. The role supports Data Management and Architecture for Global Compliance and Operational Risk and Enterprise Independent Testing areas of the bank.  Working collaboratively with Data Management leaders, Business and Technology teams, you will be a key player in designing Data solutions and ensuring strategic adherence to the Enterprise Data Management standards.  Role Overview:  Enterprise Risk & Finance Technology’s EIT team is looking for motivated new talent to drive the end to end automation goal for EIT. This role will help EIT users be able to access governed and curated datasets for testing through a virtualization layer in a quick, efficient and self-serve operating model enabling automation.  Required Skills: 10-12 years of experience in the IT field with progressive experience as an Information Architect for large and complex systems (Must have 5+ years of data architecture experience in one or more of the following areas: Data Modeling, database-focused application development, data analysis, data management and governance) Hands on skills in data modeling and Data design guidance including identification of data entities, data dependencies, and data relationships Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem solving skills Hands on design, develop and manipulate Relational Databases, Data warehouses and multidimensional databases, data mappings Solid background in Database solutions design and/or Database development Oracle Exadata, Big data tools (Hadoop, etc) Strong knowledge of data management concepts, including database structure, and proficiency with SQL and other standard database query tools Experience in data analysis, data mapping techniques Understanding of Data Management fundamentals, including metadata, data quality, and data governance Knowledge of data quality checks and processes and building it into the system Able to influence, lead, and communicate effectively across technology peers, business units, managers and senior leadership Desired Skills: Analytical skills to perform technical and functional analysis with strong communication skills Create the Information Architecture for complex Enterprise Transactional Data stores and Data warehouses Create Conceptual , Logical and Physical Data Model, Data Flows, Data Management specifications Determines database structural requirements by analyzing client operations, applications, and programming; reviewing objectives with clients; evaluating current systems; Create High Level design document for Data centric Projects

Would you like to work on complex, ground breaking technology, continually being challenged, learning and progressing your career?You could be joining a FinTech start-up within the crypto / blockchain space.As a C++ Developer you will design and develop new features and enhancements for the core platform; you'll be working across the full development lifecycle building algorithms, data structures and carrying out system level programming. Job Reference # 253337BR  Job Type Full Time  Your role As part of the Technology team, you will:   Be involved in developing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting world-class technology solutions that gives UBS the edge as the world's premier wealth manager.   Work in energetic and highly motivated global teams, across countries & time zones.   Have opportunity to build a global network and to be mentored by senior leaders.   Have access to various learning and development opportunities to upskill your knowledge whenever required.   Engaged with side projects and UBS deeply cares about the environment and communities it operates in.   You would also get to collaborate with like-minded colleagues who are making a positive difference in these areas every day.  Your team Technology sits at the very heart of UBS and plays a critical role in building, delivering and maintaining IT systems, services, and infrastructure that powers the Bank.  The mission of the Technology organization is to keep UBS competitive in a digital world by delivering timely change and innovation, while maintaining the technology platforms at the highest quality standards.  With this mission in place, we are currently hiring young and motivated graduates to join us as Software Engineers to shape the future of Banking Technology.  Your expertise You must have:   A computer science or engineering-related education background   Proficiency in at least one programming language (Java, Python, C# or C++)   Knowledge of networks, operating systems, data structures, and databases   Good communication skills, comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels   Sharp analytical and problem solving skills  In addition, we’d like to also see evidence that you can:   Analyze a problem, take a view and come to a decision   Plan, organize and communicate well make things happen   Stick with a task   Work in a team   Come up with ideas   Take initiatives to learn new technologies on your own  If you are looking for a challenging position in an international, fast-paced yet collaborative environment, join us now to shape the banking future together!  About Us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.  With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  How We Hire  This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html  Join us At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.  From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?  Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

job_title: Software Developer Backend Rust AWS C++
desc: Software Developer London / WfH to £75kSoftware Developer / Engineer (Rust AWS C++) *Hybrid WfH*. Do you have backend software engineering experience? You could be progressing your career and working with a modern tech stack in an open, collaborative environment where learning and personal development are key and there's a strong pipeline of Greenfield projects as well as flexible working.As a Software Developer / Engineer you will design and develop new features and enhancements to the core platform for a market leading software house that provide a suite of smart voice and unified communications services to a variety of clients ranging from investment banks to the emergency services.The team is about to embark on a large Greenfield project to rewrite the existing C / C++ codebase to a modern serverless architecture using Rust and AWS. You'll be continually learning and picking up new languages and technologies in a collaborative Agile team environment. There's a remote interview / onboarding process and you can work from home most of the time; the office in Central London is now open and they'd like you to go in once a week on Wednesdays. When you are in the office you can enjoy a friendly team environment that encourages knowledge sharing, close collaboration and regular company wide hack-a-thons; you'll have time dedicated every Friday afternoon to exploring your own technology interests. Requirements: You have strong backend software engineering experienceIdeally you will have commercial experience with Rust and a C/C++ background (but this could be other and personal experience)You have AWS or other cloud based experienceYou're an advocate of Agile development using Test Driven Development (TDD), unit testing, refactoringYou have a thorough understanding of Computer Science fundamentals such as OOP, Data Structures, Design Patterns, Algorithm design, SOLID design principlesYou believe in automation wherever possible and are familiar with CI/CD environmentsYou're collaborative team member with excellent communication skills As a Software Developer / Engineer you will earn a highly competitive salary (to £75k) plus bonus and benefits including 25 days holiday (with the option to buy 5 more), flexible working (including working from home), time off to participate in charity initiatives such as Code Club, gym membership, pension, medical care, wellness benefits including massage and yoga.Apply now to find out more about this Software Developer / Engineer (Rust AWS C++) opportunity.

Incorporated in November 1950, Shanghai Commercial Bank Ltd. is one of the most well known local Chinese banks in Hong Kong. At present, there are more than 40 local and overseas branches. The Bank has always been pursuing the motto of its founder, Mr. Kwang-pu Chen, to 'Serve the Community'. The Bank's slogan of 'For Personalized Service' and 'All in a Family' denotes the Bank's devotion to providing personalized services to its clients and promoting a harmonious relationship among its staff members.  Responsibilities Assist to develop and maintain appropriate data architecture and data governance framework to support the information needs, sustainable development and continuous optimization Drive and lead implementation of technical solutions to realize various data analytic capabilities enhancement initiatives from inception to completion Participate in managing IT projects end-to-end including solution evaluation, proposal preparation, project initiation/planning, risk assessment/mitigation, reporting and documentation preparation, change management as well as post-implementation and audit reviews Collaborate with different stake holders and team members to achieve project objectives in an effective and efficient manner Requirements Degree holder in Information Technology or related disciplines Minimum 5 years’ relevant IT experience, particularly specialized in solution implementation for datawarehouse, financial data models, data analytics etc., preferably in banking industry Good knowledge of latest technology development and applications, multiple best-of-breed solutions, products, tools, architecture, external ecosystems and integration strategies Strive for continuous improvement and strong organisational skills including the ability to plan, prioritize and schedule activities to ACHIEVE deliverables Good written and presentation skills to present program, reports and project plans to management and stakeholders Ability to influence others and facilitate change management through collaboration and leadership (Candidate with more relevant experience may be considered for the post of Senior System Analyst)  Attractive remuneration package will be offered to the right candidates. Interested parties please send your full resume with current and expected salary to the Human Resources Division [email redacted, apply via Company website] or by post to G.P.O. Box 139, Hong Kong.  Please visit us at www.shacombank.com.hk for more information about our Bank.  All personal data collected will be used for recruitment related purposes strictly in accordance with the Bank's personal data policies, a copy of which will be provided immediately upon request by contacting our Personal Data Compliance Officer. Applicants who are not contacted within two months may consider their applications unsuccessful and the personal data collected from the applicants will be retained for no longer than two years from the date of rejection during which the applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Bank.

job_title: Senior Project Manager- Data Center Design and Build (Physical Layer)
desc: Data Center Design & Build . Ashburn, Virginia  " Why Align  For nearly three decades, many of the world's leading firms have relied on Align as a trusted IT solution provider and center of excellence in IT advisory, infrastructure design, build, delivery and managed services. We are actively seeking innovative minds to establish and strengthen our team to deliver high-quality state-of-the-art technology solutions for our enterprise and boutique clients.  If you are seeking to own challenging projects for some of today's most fascinating companies while leveraging an exceptional team and long track record of success, then we want to hear from you today.  Position Overview  Align seeks a Senior Project Manager for our Physical Layer Data Center Design and Build team who will be able to lead our Northern VA team and be the primary relationship manager for our local clients, strategic partners and local Data Center REITs (co-location). We design and manage the build out of the Physical Layer in the Data Center (the White Space). The focus is on the physical infrastructure, such as data hall power distribution, structured cabling, and space planning. This will include a primary focus on working as a project manager in a billable, professional services (consulting) capacity. Additionally, this is an entrepreneurial role where you can lead the local team to grow the business. You will represent Align locally and build business relationships, offer pre-sales support for potential projects and follow through from project inception to final handover. Our data center team specializes in a variety of projects including greenfield builds, audits/retrofits of existing data centers and white space builds within colocation facilities. Candidate must have participated in a data center design and build projects from inception to final handover. The Senior Project Manager must be able to handle all aspects of data center white space design, deployment and implementation including:  Pre-Sales Support - Understand the value Align can bring to potential customers. Ensure that potential customers have a clear understanding of the value Align can bring to their data center project. Stay connected to the industry and be able to recognize potential opportunities for new projects.  Design - Understand customer requirements and support them in a design that best utilizes their new data center facility. This focus of design is the structural support systems, power distribution to the cabinet level, carrier infrastructures, structured cable plant and overall data center layout.  Oversight - Focus on managing the implementation of the project as designed to ensure the subcontractors are adhering to design criteria and building the data center to the client's expectations, on time and within budget.  Project Management - Ensure that the required completion date is on target, chair meetings with the client and subcontractors provide regular updates on progress to the customer. The Position will be based out of our Ashburn, VA office but must be able to travel throughout the US as needed This is afull-time position offering full benefits, a competitive salary, paid training and performance-based bonuses. You will be empowered and compensated for growing our local business. We are offering a relocation package for suitable candidates that are willing to relocate Responsibilities Act as a Project Manager on Data Center Build Outs and have the opportunity to be an entrepreneurial leader in the NOVA region Lead projects as both the senior project manager and data center design subject matter expert providing on-site support for data center design and build projects from inception to final handover. Act as the primary contact and counsel to assigned clients while ensuring project deliverables and client expectations are met. Manage multiple projects and project teams simultaneously. Develop strategic relationships locally by meeting and entertaining potential customers and local data center providers, in order to continue to grow our market share in Ashburn. Act as Account Manager for assigned clients, maintaining ongoing, professional relationships upon completion of project as required. Estimate projects and create sales proposals for new business opportunities with assistance from the corporate office and solution leads. Responsible for the development of all RFI and RFP documents required for bid leveling, overseeing comparison and analysis process. Manage client expectation and maintain status documents for client projects throughout the project re: scope, budget, billing, schedules and timeframes. Develop budget and project plans during the analysis and design phase of the project. Maintain thorough understanding of Align billing process, responsible for reviewing and approving invoicing on a project. Oversee and approve all expenses related to the project. Provide leadership, direction, team building, coaching, and decision making for problem and conflict resolution with project teams and members. Exhibit leadership characteristics: strong communication skills, full understanding of internal policies, group and individual management. Qualifications A minimum of 5+ years of relevant Data Center Facilities design and build project management experience. Possess hands-on experience with data center design and deployment best practices. In depth knowledge and subject matter expertise related to Data Center design focused on structural support systems, power distribution to the cabinet level, carrier infrastructures, structured cable plant, space planning, physical security/ access control and overall data center layout. Prior, recent experience successfully managing large-scale data center build-outs and relocation projects. Advance, in-depth IT construction and cabling infrastructure build out project experience and a good understanding of power distribution and cooling methods. A combination of working technical knowledge and a strategic understanding of current and future data center requirements. Relationships with local vendors or Data Center REITs would be a big plus Strong communication skills (both written and verbal) Strong individual and team time management skills - prioritizing and delegating tasks. RCDD, Bicsi DCDC, CDCDP or PMP or related Data Center Facilities Design certifications are a plus.  About Align  Align is a dynamic and flexible place to work, offering professionals unparalleled opportunities to train in the leading technologies, make an impact within the industry and control their own destinies. We have a flawless track record of delivering technical solutions and have established long-standing relationships with an impressive client list of both Global 1000 and SMB clients.  We work across a diverse list of industries including financial services, life sciences (pharmaceutical and health care), retail, technology, media and telecommunications. We give our professionals the autonomy to pursue opportunities and manage assignments in ways that maximize their creativity and talents, leading to self-fulfillment and financial rewards.  For more details, visit www.align.com .  Tier 2  PM20

Job Details  At Johnson Controls, sustainability has always been at the heart of our business and fundamental to everything we do as a company. We continue to pioneer new and important paths to sustainability. We welcome and embrace the enhanced attention and urgency around tackling climate change and making gains across environmental, social and governance pillars. We are determined to strengthen and further build our culture of diversity and inclusion. Our bold sustainability commitments demonstrate we are all-in to help drive healthy buildings, healthy people and a healthy planet for our employees, shareholders, customers and all our stakeholders.  What You Will Do  As a key part of our Sustainability Engineering team, you are accountable for increasing sales and margin metrics and for incorporating more of Johnson Controls' capabilities into customer sustainable solutions, shortening the solution development cycle, increasing win rates, applying appropriate solution methodologies and minimizing development costs. You design sustainable solutions for customers based on customer needs and team direction and strategies, ensuring assessments contain a broad set of our solution portfolio as appropriate for the customer’s requirements.  How You Will Do It You prepare the corresponding Johnson Controls offer You manage compelling business cases for the proposed scope of work You lead projects using Engineering Pool resources and Domain Experts as needed to deliver projects from inception through close You are responsible for the development of offers, budgets and timelines You prepare and participate in customer pre sales presentations to deliver the advantages of our sustainable solutions to our customers You develop the initial Order of Magnitude assessment during the Qualify phase and participate in energy/ CO2 emission audits under the various audit standards You develop and engineer sustainability and energy savings opportunities using Engineering Pool resources as appropriate to develop within projected costs and schedule, and provide a final solution consistent with Customer’s procurement process. For large, complex, or "high opportunity" projects, you lead teams of subject matter experts, including Centres of Engineering on multiple continents  Required  What we look for 10+ years of engineering, construction, and facility operations, with excellent knowledge of building-related systems and services. Consistent track record as project manager, energy auditor or pre-sales engineer balancing multiple projects involving energy solutions within the HVAC/ Building Automation or Energy Management/ Renewable industry Sophisticated understanding of the range of JCI's capabilities (e.g., energy management, renewable, security, fire systems, building automation systems, services, operations and maintenance, finance, etc.) and ability to combine these capabilities to solve critical customer needs for sustainability Demonstrated ability to lead processes and review the detailed work Strong understanding of the solutions performance contracting regulatory, legislative and business environment, as well as procurement requirements Project management skills for large development projects with diverse resources Excellent presentation and interpersonal skills Proven conceptual skills for developing innovative solution designs Excellent customer-facing skills, being comfortable presenting at the C-level Leadership skills with ability to quickly assemble and lead a solution development team as required Excellent business analysis skills used to build compelling business cases Willingness to travel up to 20 - 30%, within Continental Europe or UK/IE (mostly day travel with approximately 10% overnight travel) Fluent English skills and one other major European language  Preferred Bachelor's degree in Engineering - Mechanical or Architectural Third-party technical or business certifications, such as Energy Performance certification or certified auditor would be a huge plus. Proven knowledge of common applications (e.g. MS Excel, MS Project, etc.). Experience with public sector, healthcare, data center, Life science vertical markets  Read our 2021 Sustainability Report at: https://www.johnsoncontrols.com/2021sustainability as this position is a key part of the Johnson Controls Global Sustainability Services and Solutions team, focused on accomplishing our science-based decarbonization targets.  Interested in joining our team?  Please apply online and provide your salary expectations as well as a possible starting date. Your point of contact is Christine Tran.

Portsmouth Data Science Tutor Jobs  The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Data Science tutors nationally and in Portsmouth. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.  Why join our platform? Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week. Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want. Set your own hours and schedule. Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients). Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform. Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus. We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session. What We Look For In a Tutor You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality. You can show subject-matter expertise in Data Science. You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student. Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform: 1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience. Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience. VT+ Classes: teach groups of 25-30 students anything from math fundamentals to video game design. Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time. School@Home: provide support for homeschooling parents with 1-on-1 Online Tutoring and Small Group Classes. Instant Tutoring: accept subject specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like. About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring  Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.  Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.

job_title: Volunteer: 1-hour Data & Analytics call for Hartford Health Initiative
desc: Help Hartford Health Initiative by speaking with a member of their organization on the phone for 1 hour about their data and analytics needs.  Our Mission  Our mission is to improve the health outcomes of people in the City of Hartford through increased access to equitable health care and resources.  What Hartford Health Initiative Needs I'd like to brainstorm ideas for developing a database for a project that stores participant data and follow-up data responses.  Your Skills Data Analysis Your Experience Experience in data & analytics and ability to provide advice over the phone Your Availability Works remotely from anywhere 1 hour Why You'll Love Volunteering With Us Enhance your skills while supporting a cause you care about Gain samples of work & references to add to your portfolio Directly impact a community organization on the ground Work remotely & create your own schedule About Ask An Expert Calls One hour, one time calls allow an organization to speak with an expert about a particular challenge or question. Designed for the professional who seeks to fit volunteering into their busy schedule, these calls allow you to make a difference for an organization in just 1 hour.  Catchafire is committed to helping nonprofits affected by COVID-19 who need virtual volunteers now more than ever. Take a look at the projects we have available to see how you can help.  This volunteer opportunity was originally posted on Catchafire, an online tool that connects nonprofits & social enterprises with passionate professionals who want to donate their skills, pro bono. All Catchafire volunteer opportunities are well scoped, flexible, and include access to support from Catchafire's team of Nonprofit Advisors.  LinkedIn for Good Volunteering
Industries: Non-profit Organizations and Hospitals and Health Care

job_title: Student Assistant within Remote Sensing and Geoinformatics
desc: Are you eager to apply your Remote Sensing skills? And would you like to learn more on how to leverage huge amounts of satellite data to give answers to pressing questions of sustainable development? We offer you a versatile and flexible job as student assistant within the geoinformatics domain, within a company of specialized and dedicated colleagues to learn from and grow with.  Responsibilities and challenges  Interest in our Remote Sensing services is growing strongly, and we are looking for a curious and dedicated student to assist on a wide range of activities and projects. You will be part of a team of about 25 colleagues whose competencies are centred on satellite remote sensing, geoinformatics, and software development.  The main responsibilities and challenges in the job are ad hoc assistance with:  Assistance with Remote Sensing analytics tasks Desktop GIS work using QGIS and ArcGIS Acquisition and pre-processing of satellite imagery using cloud processing tools Assistance with preparation of web mapping solutions using GeoServer, Terracotta, cloud-optimized GeoTIFF, cloud storage General ad-hoc consultancy and assistance on production tasks  Qualifications and personal skills  We are looking for a new colleague who will join us and have the following qualifications:  Current BSc/MSc education within geoinformatics, geography or similar Python programming skills and interest to develop further Practical experience with analysing raster/image data Solid experience with QGIS, ArcGIS, eCognition, and other geoinformatics tools  Besides the technical skills, it would be beneficial that you:  Can work independently and focused Are self-motivated and proactive Are good at communicating about your work and progress Eager to grow your technical skills within Satellite Remote Sensing Curious on latest technologies and data within RS and geoinformatics  We offer  To work at DHI means being part of the leading Remote Sensing company in Denmark, with a strong focus on utilizing the latest science, data and tools within earth observation. We will offer you:  A versatile and challenging student job with a focus on growing your skills and working as a team A great opportunity to utilise, shape and expand your skills and expertise within geoinformatics and Remote Sensing A social and fun international working environment with innovative and dedicated colleagues on Slack and in person Work on projects that have an immediate positive impact on the real world Close interaction with our satellite data experts, software developers, UI/UX designers, and project managers Strong culture for feedback and recognition for your work Start-up feeling in terms of innovation and spirit, with the stability of an experienced business Remote work as needed Nice office and equipment in DHI’s newly built headquarters in green surroundings in Hørsholm Delicious lunch prepared by our own kitchen, fruit, coffee, and tea Focus on company culture and social belonging A healthy work environment with room for family and social life A flexible job with 12-15 hours of work per week, that allows for taking care of your studies meanwhile  Office location  In our nice new office in Hørsholm, 25 km north of Copenhagen (connected via direct bus), or remotely as needed.  How to apply  Please submit your application including CV via the relevant job posting on DHI’s website: http://www.dhigroup.com/careers  For further information please visit DHI-GRAS.COM or contact Head of Data Science and Analytics Kenneth Grogan (KEGR@DHIGROUP.COM)  About DHI  DHI is a global environmental consultancy company within water management and ecosystems. We are also Denmark's leading satellite remote sensing company, using satellite imagery and GIS for environmental mapping and monitoring and delivering services in more than 75 different countries over the past three decades. Working at DHI provides you with an opportunity to expand your network among more than 1.100 colleagues worldwide. See more at www.dhi-gras.com
Industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Environmental Services, and Research Services

desc: Job Reference # 253338BR  Job Type Full Time  Your role As part of the Technology team, you will:   Be involved in developing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting world-class technology solutions that gives UBS the edge as the world's premier wealth manager.   Work in energetic and highly motivated global teams, across countries & time zones.   Have opportunity to build a global network and to be mentored by senior leaders.   Have access to various learning and development opportunities to upskill your knowledge whenever required.   Engaged with side projects and UBS deeply cares about the environment and communities it operates in.   You would also get to collaborate with like-minded colleagues who are making a positive difference in these areas every day.  Your team  Technology sits at the very heart of UBS and plays a critical role in building, delivering and maintaining IT systems, services, and infrastructure that powers the Bank. The mission of the Technology organization is to keep UBS competitive in a digital world by delivering timely change and innovation, while maintaining the technology platforms at the highest quality standards. With this mission in place, we are currently hiring young and motivated graduates to join us as Software Engineers to shape the future of Banking Technology.  Your expertise You must have:   A computer science or engineering-related education background   Proficiency in at least one programming language (Java, Python, C# or C++)   Knowledge of networks, operating systems, data structures, and databases   Good communication skills, comfortable interacting with colleagues at all levels   Sharp analytical and problem solving skills  In addition, we’d like to also see evidence that you can:   Analyze a problem, take a view and come to a decision   Plan, organize and communicate well make things happen   Stick with a task   Work in a team   Come up with ideas   Take initiatives to learn new technologies on your own  If you are looking for a challenging position in an international, fast-paced yet collaborative environment, join us now to shape the banking future together!  About Us UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.  With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?  How We Hire  This role requires an assessment on application. Learn more about how we hire: www.ubs.com/global/en/careers/experienced-professionals.html  Join us At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.  From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?  Disclaimer / Policy Statements UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.
Industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking

job_title: Data Integration Consultant - Dell Boomi Platform
desc: A new International company is looking for Dell Boomi Experts to join their team.  Roles and Responsibilities: Design, develop, deploy and maintain integration processes between applications across the cloud and/or on-premises using the Dell Boomi Atmosphere platform (cloud integration, application integration, and enterprise web service APIs). Manage, monitor, troubleshoot and support existing integrations. Provide technical subject matter expertise and Implement encryption and security protocols. Perform unit testing and maintain developmental artifacts for audit compliance. 3 years of relevant experience with 2 full-cycle project implementations. Integration experience with Saas Applications. Strong understanding of various protocols/methods of communication, including XML, XML Schemas, WSDL, SOAP, REST, JSON, Groovy, FTP, SFTP, PGP, JDBC/SQL/RDBMS, JMS, Mail, and HTTP/HTTPS. Professional Dell Boomi Developer or Architect certification preferred

SQream develops a high performance database for (very) big data, deployed both on-prem and on cloud environments.  We are looking for a strong Senior C++ developer to join our core developer team, developing our massively parallel SQL query engine. Our team uses a mixture of in-house developed tools in order to develop a cutting-edge database which harnesses powerful NVidia GPUs.  As a team member, you'll be involved in designing and developing new features for our core product components to be used in our on-prem and cloud based SQream DB solutions.  Other responsibilities include maintaining existing C++ code, designing and implementing new features and abilities to the product, and being part of an agile development R&D organization.  Responsibilities:  Be responsible for a diverse technology stack Collaborate effectively. The role will require you to work closely with other Engineering teams Proactively look into new technologies available to us and, when appropriate, drive their adoption in the team Run projects from conception to delivery Promote modern technical approaches to every stage of software development  Requirements:  Have at least 6 years of experience in C++, writing and maintaining large codebases Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent degree Experienced with Linux Excellent technical communication Strong problem-solving skills along Ability to work independently Have a thorough knowledge of multi-threading, high-performance code Highly motivated, confident, a quick learner and team player  Advantage:  Familiar with Cloud computing architecture and implementation Have good familiarity with Database engines internals Are experienced with GPUs, specifically CUDA

Remote eligible  Preferred Qualifications Ego-free, highly motivated, action-oriented, curious learn-it-all with a growth mindset Do the right thing, all the time Strive for superior performance Comfort operating in ambiguous and unregimented environments Ability to create recommended actions across 4Ps Ability to influence others without formal authority Experience with startup fundamentals (EOS, Business Model, Finance/Burn Rate, Lean, etc.) #High HIGH

360 Recruitment are a specialist Technology recruiter, currently recruiting for a Senior Cloud Consultant to join one of the fastest-growing IT Managed Service Provider in the UK. Role: Senior Cloud Consultant (WFH) Salary: Up to £50,000  Benefits (If your salary requirement is higher than advertised, we are still keen to hear from you) Permanent Role: Full Time - Permanent Location: Working Remotely (Work from home/ WFH)Occasional/Adhoc travel to site About the Role: The Senior Cloud Consultant will provide hands-on operational support for Cloud infrastructure, including monitoring, troubleshooting and maintaining a data centre and platform infrastructure. Also, contribute to the ongoing management/support of the various Cloud environments and associated underlying technologies. Responsibilities: Assist the Architecture teams with project work and service improvements as and when required. Provisioning of customer facing services in line with technical documentation. Carry out proactive tasks in a timely and effective manner to help maximize platform and service uptime and to prevent reoccurring issues, such as resolving monitoring alerts, deploying security updates, checking watch points and other general platform/systems maintenance and administration that may be required. Act as an escalation point for other operational teams who consume resources and services from the Cloud platforms, progressing support incidents and technical escalations in line with SLAs, including escalation of incidents that the Service Desk are unable to resolve. Write and review technical documentation, including providing guidance to others. Coach and mentor other team members. Take responsibility for senior level day-to-day BAU activities and when directed, project work to ensure that the Cloud platforms meet the agreed targets for availability, compliance and capacity against (KPIs), Operational Level Agreements (OLAs), Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Service Level Targets (SLTs). Participation in the out of hours on-call rota is an expected part of the role. Experience: Essential knowledge and experience of:- Private, public and hybrid cloud hosting technologies Dedicated and multi-tenant environments Windows server and Linux operating systems Microsoft Active Directory, including group policy administration Microsoft Exchange 2010/2013/Online Powershell scripting Firewalling technologies including Fortigate and Clavister Virtualisation technologies such as VMWare, Hyper-V and KVM/Xen Backup/data replication technologies such as Carbonite (SecureVault), Zerto and Veeam SAN/NAS storage technologies HPe and Dell hardware Citrix and RDS Good Understanding of:- Principles of networking and switching IP addressing and subnetting Routing protocols such as OSPF If the role of Senior Cloud Consultant is right for you, please forward your CV to us and a specialist recruiter will be in contact with you immediately.

Direct message the job poster from Labsfordevs.com Ivan L. Founder & COO @ ASSTRA.AI - A.I. Driven B2B Sales Solutions | LABSFORDEVS.COM - Product & Software Development Teams As a specialist in API and Microservice development, you will be engaged as part of a dedicated product team.  Responsibilities:  - Work with a team of fellow engineers to design, implement, and ship scalable APIs, microservice architectures, and back-end services. - Plan and own the development of new products and features. - Create and communicate API specifications that follow best practices. - Maintain and improve the automated unit and integrations tests, especially to be run in our CI/CD pipeline.  Required qualifications:  - 4+ years of experience in software development with Python. - Hands-on experience using Python frameworks such as Django, Sanic, or FastAPI for building REST or GraphQL APIs that run in production environments. - Experience with common databases, such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB, and other data stores, such as Redis and S3. - Fundamental understanding of containerization and distributed application architectures using Docker and Kubernetes.  Preferred qualifications:  - University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or any related technical field. - Familiar with asynchronous programming, especially in Python. - Experience building microservice architectures using message brokers, such as RabbitMQ or Apache Kafka. - Experience working with mono repositories and building systems. - Experience writing technical requirements and documentation. - Hands-on experience deploying and running machine learning models in production.

Phoenix Data Science Tutor Jobs  The Varsity Tutors platform has thousands of students looking for online Data Science tutors nationally and in Phoenix. As a tutor who uses the Varsity Tutors platform, you can earn good money, choose your own hours, and truly make a difference in the lives of your students.  Why join our platform? Enjoy competitive rates and get paid 2x per week. Choose to tutor as much or as little as you want. Set your own hours and schedule. Get paired with students best-suited to your teaching style and preferences (from thousands of potential clients). Tutor online (i.e. “work remotely”) using our purpose-built Live Learning Platform. Students can take adaptive assessments through the platform and share results to help you decide where to focus. We collect payment from the customers, so all you have to do is invoice the session. What We Look For In a Tutor You have excellent communication skills and a friendly, approachable personality. You can show subject-matter expertise in Data Science. You have the ability to personalize lessons for each student. Discover all the ways you can reach students through the online platform: 1-on-1 Online Tutoring: connect with an individual student for a highly personalized learning experience. Small Group Classes: meet with small groups (typically 7-9 students) for a more collaborative learning experience. VT+ Classes: teach groups of 25-30 students anything from math fundamentals to video game design. Large Live Classes: share your knowledge with hundreds of students at a time. School@Home: provide support for homeschooling parents with 1-on-1 Online Tutoring and Small Group Classes. Instant Tutoring: accept subject specific, on-demand tutoring sessions whenever you’d like. About Varsity Tutors And 1-on-1 Online Tutoring  Our mission is to transform the way people learn. We do this by leveraging advanced technology, AI, and the latest in learning science to facilitate a personalized learning experience. With 1-on-1 Online Tutoring, individual students are connected with tutors for a highly personalized learning experience. We believe our thoughtful approach to matching students with the right tutors can improve outcomes, and we look forward to connecting you with students hungry to learn.  Please note: Varsity Tutors does not contract in: Alaska, California, Delaware, Hawaii, Maine, New Hampshire, North Dakota, Vermont, West Virginia or Puerto Rico.

job_title: Senior Embedded Software Designer - Linux Middleware
desc: About Us:  Headquartered in Ottawa, BTA Design serves the electronic design community from Canada, specializing in ASIC and FPGA design and verification, and embedded software development services. We augment and enhance our clients’ teams and accelerate the development of complete designs.  We’re adaptable and efficient, with a brilliant staff at our core. We aim to be the best at what we do.  Our success continues to fuel growth. We are currently searching globally for a number of key technical resources, including a Senior Embedded Software Designer with expertise in Linux base layer and middleware development.  We are looking for world-class engineers, and that means worldwide searching. If you are an exceptional embedded designer with an interest in coming to Canada to work with us, we want to hear from you.  About the Position:  In this role you will interact with software and hardware groups to work on the latest carrier-grade embedded networking software.  Key Responsibilities: Specification and development of embedded software for use in Linux environments and standalone products Development of base layer and middleware embedded software Low level hardware driver development in the Linux kernel and/or user space Development of an SDK for a new product Architecture and design of a new system, implementation and testing of new code integrated with existing and third-party code  Essential Qualifications: A minimum of an undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Computer or Electrical Engineering or the equivalent combination of skills and experience. 10+ years of relevant embedded software experience. Highly skilled and experienced in C/C++, Python and Bash. Experience with embedded software development in a Linux environment including multi-threading and IPC. Experience developing, building and releasing SDKs. Experience developing applications and low level hardware drivers in Linux kernel and user space. Knowledge of Yocto Project, writing recipes, managing various versions and packages. Low level architectural understanding and development experience with ARM embedded processors (A53) and microcontrollers.  Significant Assets: Experience with Yang modelling. Knowledge of CMIS standard. Experience customizing Linux and Linux kernels for embedded systems. VxWorks or FreeRTOS or similar experience. Experience designing and bringing up BOOTROMs required, U-Boot. Experience with general algorithms, data structures and memory management. Wired networking experience on optical transport, switch or router platforms.  Why Work Here?  We offer interesting work in challenging, stimulating technical environments with companies that lead the world in technology and innovation.  We recognize that our strength is in the individuals who join our team, so at BTA Design Services, we foster an environment where everyone is appreciated, trusted and engaged. We recognize that work-life balance is important and we strive to provide our employees with challenging roles that also allow them to enjoy family, friends and life outside of work.  Powered by JazzHR  hPlo5ISsNK

Chceš se stát seniorem v Go? Zajímá Tě problematika psaní aplikací pro multi-thread? Chceš navrhovat vlastní řešení problému?  Chceš být součástí vznikající Go komunity? Pak hledáme právě tebe.  Co Tě u nás čeká? Zpočátku bys začal pracovat na menších úkolech, především UNIT testech. Na těch si osaháš, jak tady Go píšeme a jak naše aplikace fungují. Jakmile si aplikace osaháš, přejdeme k větším úkolům zabývajících se refactoringem. Zde už budeš sám navrhovat řešení, které spolu budeme konzultovat. Zpětnou vazbu ke kódu budeš dostávat skrze code review. Také spolu nastavíme individuální rozvojový plán, kde si vytyčíš cíle a to, jak je budeš plnit. Nejprve bude tento plán zaměřen především na Go ale poté už bude na tobě, v čem se budeš chtít rozvíjet.  Co budeš rozvíjet? BLS (“Betsys Live Source“) – slouží pro poskytování feedů (data o zápasech, např. změna kurzů sázek) třetím stranám. Pro komfort sázkařů je potřeba distribuovat data ve velmi krátkém čase – stovky milisekund. Systém v tuto chvíli prochází refactoringem. Mění se infrastruktura, aby byl systém škálovatelný. Vznikají nové komponenty v Go.  Replication Handler – replikuje WAL z PostgreSQL do RabbitMQ ohledně nabídky, vsazených ticketech. Rychlost odbavování WAL je kritická pro stabilitu nabídkové databáze a zajištění integrity dat. Proto je potřeba zajistit, aby se data (tisíce logů) zpracovála co nejrychleji. V peaku Replication Handler odbavoval až 20.000 logů za sekundu. Dalším krokem ve vývoji aplikace je zvýšení stability rozšířením automatických testů a refactoring za účelem optimalizace performance pomocí profilingu a tracingu.  Čeho budeš součástí? V rámci firmy jsme vytvořili komunitu, kterou nazýváme Go Guilda. Tvoří ji lidé napříč týmy, které alespoň okrajově zajímá Go. Sdílíme zde znalosti, best practices, společné code review, chyby, ze kterých jsme se poučili. Prostě vše ohledně Go. Momentálně uvažujeme o poskytování některých našich toolů/utilit jako open source. Naším cílem je vytvořit nejen komunitu pro Betsys, ale také vybudovat Go komunitu v Česku a nakonec třeba hostit i GopherCon CZ.  Co musíš umět a chtít? Dobré logické myšlení Ovládat základy Go – syntaxe, jak funguje, výhody a nevýhody, motivace Zkušenosti s vývojem produkčních BE aplikací v jiném jazyce Ochotu aktivně rozvíjet své znalosti a dovednosti  A co oceníme? Zkušenosti s konkurenčností Zájem o SW architekturu Znalost GITu, CI & CD Psaní UNIT testů

job_title: PhD Position – Computational quantum many-body physics
desc: Advertising division: PGI-8 - Quantum Control  Reference number: 2022D-052 apply now job (pdf)  The development of quantum technologies and machine learning are two of the most dynamic research directions of our time. Within the Helmholtz Young Investigator Group “Machine Learning for Quantum Technology” we aspire to merge the parallel advancements of both fields, where quantum challenges match the natural strengths of machine learning and, reversely, the quantum applications call for the development of new machine learning techniques. Therefore, our research targets the exciting intersection of (non-equilibrium) quantum matter, quantum optics, quantum information, and machine learning with the goal of enabling benchmarking and control of quantum devices at the utmost of our computational toolbox.  The Young Investigator Group is part of the Peter Grünberg Institute - Quantum Control (PGI-8) at Forschungszentrum Jülich, which specializes in novel optimal control strategies for emerging quantum technologies. Current research directions include tensor network methods, machine learning, in-situ optimal control, and quantum model reduction techniques.  We are offering a  PhD Position – Computational quantum many-body physics  Your Job  A central objective of our work is the advancement of numerical simulation techniques based on neural quantum states. The underlying idea of this approach is to tackle the quantum curse of dimensionality by exploiting the proven merit of artificial neural networks for dealing with high-dimensional data. This new numerically exact technique can overcome existing limitations of established computational methods. Thereby, it opens up new areas for numerical investigations, which are at the same time brought into focus by recent developments in quantum simulation – for example with Rydberg atom arrays. Your tasks in detail will be: Method development to advance neural quantum states Simulation of non-equilibrium dynamics with connection to quantum simulation experiments Participation in international conferences in Germany and abroad (incl. presenting your research results) Preparing scientific publications and project reports Early-on co-tutoring of younger students  Your Profile  Masters degree in Physics, ideally with a specialization in quantum many-body physics Coursework and experience in (a subset of) quantum mechanics, condensed matter physics, computational physics, statistical physics, non-equilibrium quantum many-body physics Methodological competence: Strong programming skills, ideally including experience in deep learning and/or high performance computing Very good English communication skills – both verbal and written High degree of independence and commitment Very reliable and conscientious style of working Excellent ability to cooperate and work in a team  Our Offer  We work on the very latest issues that impact our society and are offering you the chance to actively help in shaping the change! We offer ideal conditions for you to complete your doctoral degree: A highly motivated working group as well as an international and interdisciplinary working environment at one of Europe’s largest research establishments Outstanding scientific and technical infrastructure Opportunity to participate in (international) conferences, schools, and workshops Continuous scientific mentoring by your scientific advisors A large research campus with green spaces, offering the best possible means for networking with colleagues and pursuing sports alongside work Further development of your personal strengths, e.g. through an extensive range of training courses; a structured program of continuing education and networking opportunities specifically for doctoral researchers via JuDocS, the Jülich Center for Doctoral Researchers and Supervisors: https://www.fz-juelich.de/judocs Targeted services for international employees, e.g. through our International Advisory Service  The position is for a fixed term of 3 years. Pay in line with 75% of pay group 13 of the Collective Agreement for the Public Service (TVöD-Bund) and additionally 60 % of a monthly salary as special payment („Christmas bonus“). Further information on doctoral degrees at Forschungszentrum Jülich including our other locations is available at: www.fz-juelich.de/gp/Careers_Docs  To apply, please submit a complete CV, letter of motivation, university degree records (both Bachelor’s and Master’s degree), as well as two reference donors.  We welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds, e.g. in terms of age, gender, disability, sexual orientation / identity, and social, ethnic and religious origin. A diverse and inclusive working environment with equal opportunities in which everyone can realize their potential is important to us. job_title: Fall 2022 Co-op: Data Experience & Business Analyst
desc: Our Digital & Technology team wakes up every day with one goal in mind – to connect Canadians to the people and things that matter most. Collectively, we’re proud to support 30 million Canadians each month.  We manage a robust portfolio that champions the leading edge of technology and media. We drive projects that expand connectivity to underserved communities from coast-to-coast-to-coast; build and enhance our fixed broadband network to provide high-speed Internet, TV and Smart Home Monitoring; and support our world class wireless network, offering our customers Canada’s largest and most reliable 5G network. As the Digital & Technology team, we are building our tomorrow, today.  Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.  Do you enjoy working on high-scale, complex, and high visibility projects and programs? If yes, consider the following opportunity  Start your career with a strong foundation and spend your Co-op work term with us! Our Co-op Program gives students the opportunity to be involved in meaningful projects, contribute real work, rewarding opportunities and learn from a diverse group of leaders. We are building for tomorrow and as we plan for the future to make more possible for all Canadians, we believe it starts with Students & New Grads from coast-to-coast-to-coast.  At Rogers, your journey is filled with limitless possibilities - let’s make your dream co-op placement possible.  About The Team  If you have always wanted to work at an entrepreneurial company where the employees are committed to solving big challenges and making a real difference; then join Rogers. We are a leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. We are looking for individuals who are curious, love digital & technology, and want to be part of our goal that will push the customer experience to the next level.  For our Fall 2022 term, Our Data Analysis team is seeking individuals for various roles that will be the part of our data governance, supply and vendor management, and business & experience analysis teams. Our interns will get exposure to different technologies and products while collaborating with cross functional teams for development, research, strategy building, and implementation tasks.  What You Will Do Work closely on research and analyzing feedback with multiple stakeholders across the business departments which includes Engineering, IT, Consumer & R4B products, User experience, and be a part of a scrum team to deliver quality, stability and innovation to Rogers Customers. Track and measure efficiency & delivery of all initiatives (impact on business and customer satisfaction) through automation, waste – elimination against established targets. Put your creative mind to explore new ideas, define user stories and apply best practices to contribute meaningful projects that will help improve our products. Work with Enterprise Data Governance leads and Data Stewards to define and instrument metadata capture and storage for the CDE’s, evolve our common business glossary, and facilitate the linkage between business terms and the underlying technical metadata Assist in creating financial analysis models, supplier governance processes, commercial models supporting our teams hold suppliers to account, define new IT capabilities and manage supplier risks for Rogers. What You Will Bring… Currently enrolled in post-secondary education with a focus on Computer Science, Applied Science, Electrical Engineering, Statistics, Business Technology Management, or related field. Command on Microsoft Office, Power BI, Python, SQL, Jira can be considered as an asset. Nice to have knowledge on Lean Six Sigma, Cisco, VMware. Good to have familiarity with the operations of telecommunication industry. Strong Communication skills (written and oral) and Interpersonal skills required; Bilingualism (English and French) can be considered as an asset A strong team player comfortable working in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment A mindset of creativity, innovation and energetic drive to succeed Here’s What You Can Expect In Return A team who deeply cares about your development and long term career at Rogers A team that trusts and wants to win together A competitive salary Access to leading edge technology and services so we can make more possible for our customers and our business every day. A campus team that will keep you engaged through onboarding and your work term. As a condition of hire, all new employees will be required to provide proof of vaccinations against COVID 19. Any request for an exception under Human Rights legislation must be supported by evidence to be considered by Rogers on a case by case basis.  Please click here to review conditions that may qualify for medical exemption to the COVID-19 vaccine.  Schedule [[req_RogersFullPartTime]]  Shift Day  Length of Contract 4 Months  Work Location 8200 Dixie Rd (341), Brampton, ON  Travel Requirements None  Posting Category/Function Student/New Grad & Co-op  Requisition ID 268313  At Rogers Digital, our team doesn’t shy away from big ideas – we bring them to life. We work tirelessly to deliver the best user experiences (period) and build amazing self-serve experiences that our customers want to use. We are customer-obsessed agents of change and are committed to innovation and creating effortless experiences for customers and frontline employees. We use cutting-edge tools and technologies to solve critical and complex problems with award-winning solutions. Our work impacts millions of customers everyday. At Rogers Digital, we’re looking for people who embrace change, take risks, and push boundaries. Learn more about our team and our work @ https//digital.rogers.com/  Together, we'll make more possible, and these six shared values guide and define our work Our people are at the heart of our success Our customers come first. They inspire everything we do We do what’s right, each and every day We believe in the power of new ideas We work as one team, with one vision We give back to our communities and protect our environment Posting Notes Student and New Grad

desc: At Opply, our strength is the efficiency with which we deliver leading-edge products and support to those we serve. We are building an end-to-end supply solution for 25 Million small brands worldwide and are one of the fastest-growing startups in the UK. Now, we are looking for people who are passionate about going on this exciting journey with us!To help us continue our growth, we’re seeking an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. What is awaiting you is the possibility to work on a completely new product, a lot of freedom and responsibility right from the start and no annoying legacy code! Our product will largely be shaped by you!**Your duties and responsibilities will include the following:** Work end-to-end from data exploration, data structuring, creating data pipelines and preparing the deployment of ML models** Conceptualize and guide the development of the next iteration of our *brand-supplier matching algorithm *to solve one of the biggest inefficiencies in the B2B space* Mentor and lead the data team *(As we grow, there will be a split between mentorship and supporting junior data engineers & scientist and being hands on)* Contribute to building our data infrastructure from the ground up *and be involved in all data-related decision making* Collaborate closely with the lead developer and backend engineer, the product lead as well as the CTO and translate product needs into data-driven solutions* Build the world’s highest quality supplier database, which is the backbone of our platform***What experience you have:** 5+ years of hands-on data experience *and ideally you have *built products from scratch** Expert knowledge in Python *and common data libraries* Experience with ML* Experience with PostgreSQL** Experience in processing and standardizing *highly unstructured data** Ideally experience with Elasticsearch* Ideally you have already worked in a fast-paced start-up environment before***Who you are:** You are an empathetic and inspirational leader *who mentors all team members*** You are a super fast learner. You have the natural curiosity and intellectual prowess to deeply understand new topics and pick up new skills in rapid time* You care a lot about writing clean and efficient code *but you also know when something is "good enough"* You are resourceful and scrappy. Things need to get done, you always find a way to make it happen. Even when the work is hard, you are relentless in delivering even with limited information and ambiguity* You are passionate. You are an optimistic with a positive energy that other people draw upon-* Equity in one of the fastest-growing startups in London** 33 days holiday a year *(incl. UK public holidays)* Enrolment into the company Pension Scheme* Flexible working hours & flexible remote working* WeWork All Access *membership (worldwide and dog-friendly!)* Cycle to work scheme* Personalised benefits that you can choose e.g. gym, medical insurance* Regular team socials & lots of other surprisesWe keep the recruitment process short and sweet:* Intro call with our co-founder & CTO Martin (30 mins)* Take-home assignment (Python) (~3 h)* Follow-up call on the assignment & other questions (45 mins)* Founder & Team meet (30 mins)* Offer & Onboarding!We typically keep the time span between intro call and offer below 10 days!**Python, ElasticSearchPython, GCP, REST, PostgreSQL

Inventory Analyst for a fast paced, high growth online retail company  This Jobot Job is hosted by Hanani Carlisle  Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button and sending us your resume.  Salary $31 - $40 per hour  A Bit About Us  Great opportunity for an Inventory Analyst with a fast paced, high growth online retail company.    Why join us?   Benefits Employee Health/Dental/Vision benefits covered 75% by KQ, family covered 50% Paid Vacation 7 Paid Holidays 401k Program (6% matching) Job Details  Responsibilities  Oversee the inventory accuracy of all systems and for all site. This role will own the accuracy of the inventory with the goal of reducing or eliminating overselling before, during, and after each sales event. The inventory analysis will work cross functionally with the on-site inventory team, web/marketing team, and leadership team to cycle through products and stay one step ahead of the event schedule. They will also establish standard operating procedures for researching and addressing inventory discrepancies. Partner with the web/marketing team to identify root causes of issues impacting inventory accuracy and assist with implementing solutions. This role will also be responsible for supporting accounting efforts to value our fluctuating inventory. This role will report to the VP of Fulfillment Operations.  Essential Functions Leads the entire inventory audit process including staffing, scheduling, and final resolution. Monitors all inventory adjustments being made in all facilities for accurate inventory. Report, review, investigation into the system, etc. of transactions or any discrepancies Monitor all systems, bridges, interfaces for update errors and out of synch conditions. Working with reports, e-mails from other locations, etc. Reviews all procedures which effect inventory update for accuracy. Review reports, visit with staff, work with management Reviews vendor documentation to ensure accuracy of new product information both on the product and within each system. Implement new processes to improve efficiencies when processing new inventory Meeting with management to review areas for process improvement and labor saving Become Subject Matter Expert (SME) for all systems related to inventory and e-commerce Other duties as assigned Experience/Qualifications  Minimum Degree Required Bachelor’s Degree Education and Experience may be substituted for each other where applicable Preferred Experience Warehouse management systems (SKU Vault, JASCI), Shopify, Google sheets, Google Data Studio, Advanced Excel  Experience 3+ years’ experience  COVID-19 Considerations  All employees must be fully vaccinated. Proof of vaccination status is required at the time of employment.  People are considered fully vaccinated 2 weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as the Pfizer or Moderna vaccines, or 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson & Johnson’s Janssen vaccine.  KN95 face masks are required to be worn at all times in the workplace.  Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply" button.
