We are looking for a marketing technology professional with a very strong focus on digital analytics who loves to transmit his/her passion for web technologies and big data projects to clients to shape and drive their digital solutions and experiences. You are a good fit if you are a sharp mind that gathers and analyses marketing & business needs and translates into efficient marketing platform solutions. Translating marketing planning and processes into workflows and required marketing tech stacks, especially covering Digital Analytics.   Netcentric may probably feel like home for you, if you are flexible, even when choosing your working spot anew everyday. You master one of the leading Analytics Solutions such as Google Analytics 360, Google Marketing Platform, Adobe Analytics,  Adobe Marketing Cloud, Tealium, Salesforce etc. and are eager and willing to expand your knowledge beyond them. Resting on your laurels is not familiar to you, nor is it for us.  In your day to day activities you will ...  Consult and master projects with respect to tracking and measuring all desired on and offline touchpoints   Advocate and consult customers through the creation of Analytics, Data Management and Customer Data Platform solutions  Translate and define technical requirements for your internal colleagues and Technology Engineers to build and implement the desired solutions such as Tag Management Systems, Data Layers, Online & Offline Data Conjunction, Channel and Touchpoint Integrations, Implementation of various platforms and reporting solutions together with A/B Testings and high end personalization solutions  Establish standard data privacy compliant processes for client’s digital properties,  to set up, maintain and track data for reach, performance, engagement and other behavior metrics  Project manage account analytics efforts setting company-wide best practices and processes  Manage Digital Analytics projects end to end from client handling, implementation, QA and support including trainings and ongoing customer support    Qualifications  What do we require?  A proven record in managing analytics and data management projects   Being able to develop strategies for data management solutions in digital marketing with a solid understanding of tracking omni-channel touchpoints  5+ years of hands-on experience with Analytics / Digital Marketing tools and services with e.g. Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics 360, Google Optimize, Google Cloud Products incl. BigQuery, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Launch, Adobe Audience Manager, Tealium, Pega, Salesforce, Data Studio, Tableau, Looker.  Sound knowledge of CDP, DMP, DSP, Ad Serving landscape  Ability to multi-task and perform effectively under pressure  Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and German language  What makes us smile when looking at your profile…  You are able to read/write basic HTML/HTML5 /CSS/JavaScript, other front end languages (Python, NodeJS, PHP, etc.), and ability to query large databases (SQL)  Detailed experience in Online Marketing campaign and performance management  Experience in tag architecture analysis and using tagging platform(s) to execute proper data flow  Ability to explain architecture proposals to non-technical audiences and communicate business value of suggested ideas & plans  Solid understanding of data privacy and data governance regulations such as GDPR    Additional Information  What do we offer YOU?  Permanent contract 30 working days of vacation for all employees Flexible working hours, with respect to project needs Recognition bonus system Continuous training and coaching Dynamic and international team Sponsored gym membership Apple work equipment Central office locations with great office space Table football Many off-site company events Kitchen access with a large selection of teas, coffee and Bionade Everyone has a voice, we are a Holacracy organization

Description:* Responsible for assisting the Accounts Payable Manager in overseeing the Shared Services Department. Primary responsibilities include managing the staff that processes employee expense reports, managing foreign reporting vendor/invoice processing, and IRS tax compliance and reporting. Additional responsibilities include maintaining a thorough knowledge of the Oracle and 170 systems, assisting with data entry and assisting with month-end close. Will work closely with Finance department personnel and external customers. Supervise the expense reporting staff/process and assist the Shared Services Manager in overseeing the accounts payable staff/process: Responsible for the direct supervision of the day-to-day activities for the Travel and Entertainment (T&E) expense functions. Coach and mentor staff Prepare annual performance appraisals for both the T&E and Accounts Payable staff. Manage foreign reporting and IRS tax compliance/reporting. Responsible for analyzing/researching tax information for developing and implementing procedures to ensure IRS tax compliance information reporting and withholding – 1099/1042 solutions. Responsible for managing the Foreign Reporting vendor/invoice processes and supporting the AP Manager with preparing the 1042-S files for submitting to Sovos Compliance LLC for printing, mailing, and filing with the IRS. *Description:*  We are in need of two Linux Engineers with Containerization experience to support upgrades to a large submarine program.  This is a technology to create common, open-architecture system-of-systems electronic designs aboard most Navy submarines to promote interoperability during joint operations with integrated fighting forces.  That means you will have the opportunity to work on a program that is essential to every single submarine in the US Fleet to make it easier to integrate all the different subsystems together in an extremely efficient manner.  Responsibilities: Linux Configuration (50%) Troubleshooting, Testing, and Integration (25%) Writing Docker/Kubernetes Containers (25) Use Python as a daily requirement Participate in Agile Scrums (daily) https://www.lockheedmartin.com/us/what-we-do/aerospace-defense/naval-systems.html Test the JD: This person will be responsible for Linux integration efforts (configuring the OS on a black piece of hardware) and writing the docker and kubernetes containers.  They will also get involved in mentoring junior engineers on the Container technology Best vs Average: 3+ years of experience with Containers This group is the problem solver for the rest of the engineers on the team so they need to love to solve problems.  When an issue arises with another group and they cannot solve it then is gets escalated to this group to solve. Disqualifers: Must be eligible for a US Secret Clearance A System Admin who has never configured a RHEL OS on a blank piece of hardware No significant experience with Python or Bash Skills:*  troubleshoot, linux, red hat, rhel, python, big data, Kubernetes, Containers, Devops, Cloud, Jenkins, Docker Top Skills Details:*  troubleshoot, linux, red hat, rhel, python, big data,Kubernetes,Containers Additional Skills & Qualifications:*  Required: Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related degree 3+ Years of configuring a Red Hat Enterprise Linux OS on black hardware (experience with Kickstart and Python are major pluses) 2+ Years of experience writing Kubernetes Containers (Docker, Podman, K3s skills, also K8s, KDE2 would be helpful) 2+ Years using Python or Bash as the main scripting language 1+ Year of experience in an Agile Scrum Development Environment Active Secret Clearance (Interim is fine) Preferred Experience: Virtual Technologies (KVM, VMWare, Kickstart) Compute Cluster Technologies CI/CD Experience with Docker, Hadoop, GIT, Gerritt, Jenkins Experience with testing software: junit, google test, google mock, test ng, cppunit Experience Level:*  Intermediate Level  About Actalent:  Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

At TrackDDB, data is the driving force behind our creative solutions. Our team of talented professionals – from analysts and technologists to strategists and creatives – works together to exceed our clients’ business objectives through the perfect mix of data, strategy and creativity.  We are searching for a dedicated, team-oriented Data Marketing Analyst who is a strong, confident communicator and is adaptable to different levels of data availability, analytics maturity and toolsets. In this role, they will pair their digital marketing experience with skills in data collection and analytics to deliver valuable insights and evidence-driven strategy for our internal teams and clients. They will find ways to solve complex challenges that may involve creative, strategic, technical and analytical aspects. They must have experience in finding and applying data-driven insights to lead business and marketing strategy.  What We Can Offer You A friendly culture deeply rooted in mutual respect for everyone’s time and individual goals Opportunity for professional growth, training and industry leadership in our category DDB perks, including competitive benefits, referral bonuses and our unique FUEL program to help fund inspiration outside of working hours  Responsibilities Work directly with clients, team members and senior leadership to develop analytics strategy Improve profitability and drive revenue through creating effective KPIs and optimization of metrics that affect them Guide the development of key processes by supporting, prioritizing, defining, and gathering needs for the cross-functional projects; convert this data into business narratives for areas of development Lead analytics on projects of varying sizes and complexity, including report automation, data visualization, tool implementation requirements gathering and documentation, split testing, and ad hoc analysis and data mining Ensure the integrity of analytics data by ensuring policies around data governance and working with agency and client teams to provide tools and training Drive strategy for customer acquisition and customer conversion by developing models, forecasts, and analyses that are based on previous activity and benchmark data Interpret analytical findings and/or recommend an approach and solution(s) that are relative to the strategic objectives of the project, company, and stakeholder needs Use advanced analytics techniques on large data sets for the purpose of delivering ad hoc analyses and insights; formulate analytics-enabled solutions in an online advertising environment Facilitate and perform consistent and reliable data collection, utilizing primary and secondary research methods; perform analysis for testing, targeting, creative and offers Creation of post campaign reporting and work with design teams to build engaging data visualization  Qualifications Curious, self-starter, works independently and within a team environment Undergraduate degree in social sciences, business, computer science, mathematics or related quantitative discipline 1-3+ years analytical experience: strong presentation skills, flexible, adaptable, resourceful, assertive & proactive, able to simplify and package complex ideas for presentation Deep knowledge of digital, social and mobile marketing principles within the context of broader mass communications Experience in using analytics to effectively drive digital strategy and business transformation Keen ability to work within a team, with experience of project ownership/leadership A strategic and analytical in approach to your work; thoughtful, goal-oriented Experience with marketing attribution modeling Demonstrated experience in requirements gathering and documentation for web analytics implementation including KPI development, tagging and report automation. Intermediate level capabilities with SQL Intermediate level capabilities with Adobe Analytics and/or Google Analytics Familiarity with R and/or Python Demonstrated ability to effectively maintain focus while working on multiple complex projects Bonus Points for: Experience with Tableau Proficiency with statistical analysis (regression models, cluster or factor analysis) #DDBCANADA

As a Project Coordinator you will have the option to progress through many Project Delivery Roles or you may choose a different avenue within the Business. We are a growing company with many career development opportunities across the Business. The role offers a salary up to £26k, bonus, the option to work from home and the office, and a flexible benefits fundKey Responsibilities Scheduling of meetings through Microsoft Outlook/Teams. Including tracking acceptance/decline and ensuring all parties attend meetings on-time and fully prepared.Build and track basic task lists with owners and due dates to ensure that tasks are met.Regular updating of customer facing Project Management Project reports.Co-ordination of shipping, both domestic and international. Liaising with the Sales Ops team to ensure timely delivery, tracking and receipt of shipping in-line with Project plans.Providing numerical data, reporting and general support to the Head of Project Operations and Programme Manager on Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Project and Power BI (MS Project and Power BI skills not essential as full training will be given).Project Governance: Support the Xalient Programme Manager(s) to ensure that all Project related governance is completed, and standards maintained against all Project delivered.Customer satisfaction: Track customer satisfaction reports across all Projects and provide in report format Skills and experience EssentialAbility to work 11am – 7pm to cover US hoursAt least 1 years’ experience working for an IT/Data/Telecommunications or security reseller, vendor or similar, in a project administration function.A basic non-technical level of understanding of IT Network and SecurityGood fundamental Microsoft Office skills in Word, Power Point and OutlookStrong Microsoft Excel skills: including Index/Match, VLOOKUP, IF format with conditions, PMT and formula based conditional formatting.A basic understanding of Business and Project ManagementWilling to train and learn (PRINCE 2 Foundation for example)Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbalAbility to work independently and remotely where requiredExceptional time management and organisational skillsDesirableMicrosoft Project skills are desirable but not essential. Work on Project Web App or Project Server also useful Job Offer £26k plus bonus Hybrid working (home and office) Pension Regular socials in the officeXalientWe are an award-winning, IT consulting and managed services business, specialising in modern, software-defined networking, security and communications technologies, delivering innovative solutions and services to major organisations right across the globe.Our service portfolio ranges from consulting strategies and assessments through to solution design, deployment and fully managed services, incorporating market-leading technologies in each of our specialist areas.In 2021 Xalient was named by Dun & Bradstreet as #6 in its inaugural Accelerate 50, recognising the 50 fastest growing tech companies headquartered in the UK. job_title: Senior Statistical Programmer / Med Tech / MNC / Up to SGD10,000/Mth!
desc: Requirements  My client, a US MNC whom is a leading Healthcare IT software company is looking out for a competent Senior Statistical Programmer to support their company's growth to new levels: Lead, or contribute to, statistical programming activities on PBS projects (development or QC of deliverables): delivering exemplary performance and solving complex technical problems to inspire other programmers, ensuring an efficient collaboration with PBS global teams (Europe, India, and US) being accountable for the quality, traceability, reproducibility and timeliness of statistical programming deliverables, being accountable for overall client satisfaction with these deliverables, maintaining a detailed project and validation plan, efficiently communicating with internal and external clients, ensuring budget monitoring and adherence Ensure the statistical programming systems, processes and deliverables are aligned with the relevant regulatory requirements, for instance: Clinical study reporting, e.g. ICH E3 Electronic records handling, e.g. Chapter 21 of the US Code of Federal Regulation - Part 11 Electronic submission of clinical data to agencies, e.g. e-CTD guidance and CDISC SDTM and ADaM standards Provide input into, and mentor statistical programmers to provide input into documents produced by other functions (e.g. biostatisticians, data managers, medical writers…) Understand, follow and ensure adherence to all BDM SOP as well as any other relevant SOPs. Keep abreast of current and new statistical programming techniques and other applicable technical advancements while assisting in their implementation Qualifications BSc or equivalent with research experience, and/or MS (in a numerate discipline preferably in Statistics, Computer Science, or Mathematics) 8+ years of experience in biostatistics or statistical programming activities in the Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology industry in clinical development, with 2+ years of CRO experience Experience as a lead statistical programmer on several concurrent projects Strong SAS programming skills Strong CDISC ADaM and SDTM- production/validation. Good understanding of drug development, including knowledge of interfaces and interdependencies with other functions. Good knowledge of relevant regulatory and data submission guidelines. Project management skills Fluent in English (French and/or German is a plus) Ability to work effectively in international teams, effectively operates within a matrix organization and with multi-disciplinary groups, excellent team player with strong interpersonal skills contributing to building the team spirit How To Apply  Interested applicants may apply by sending in your updated résumé (in MS Word format) to my email or apply directly:  Consultant: Tan Jun Jie  EA personnel reg. no.R1878852  EA License No. 17C8502

job_title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Quantum Motion with Turing Talent Leadership Program
desc: About the company Quantum Motion is a UK based, fast-growing quantum computing start-up, founded by researchers from UCL and Oxford University who have pioneered the development of qubits and quantum computing architectures. Backed by a team of top-tier investors, they are one of the “Top 100 Startups worth watching” in the EE Times, and their technology breakthroughs have been featured in The Telegraph, BBC and the New Statesman. https://quantummotion.tech/ What you will be working on: This is an exciting opportunity to lead a new Intelligent Automation Team in Quantum Motion to work alongside other teams on IC Engineering and Quantum Engineering. You will be working on transforming the automation of key parts of both the characterisation and operation of the quantum processor and its constituent parts. Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools for the automation of the characterisation and operation of semiconductor quantum devices and processors Run machine learning tests and experiments, including statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results Lead the interaction with the testing team in order to build and maintain a high quality dataset for ML testing along with the development of a rigorous testing procedure to determine the quality of models on fresh data. Support the wider deployment of ML tools developed by the Intelligent Automation to other teams within the company Prepare progress reports and appropriate documentation for the tools developed Must-have skills: Experience in at least one of the following areas: Machine Learning, Pattern Recognition, Computer Vision Proficiency with Python and basic libraries for machine learning Strong and structured approach to problem-solving and communicating complex topics in an effective manner A passion for tackling big challenges and, in particular, for developing quantum computers Nice-to-have skills: Industrial/commercial experience as a Machine Learning Engineer Experience in developing software which interacts with test & measurement hardware Experience in technical mentoring/supervision Why Apply? A rare opportunity to be an early employee in a creative and world-leading start-up team shaping the future of quantum computing Growth. Automatic enrolment of the Turing Talent Leadership Programme, designed for technical individuals to accelerate your career and personal development A competitive salary Comprehensive benefits package including share options, contributory pension and cycle-to-work schemes as well as life assurance and option to choose your own laptop/kit Flexible working from office or remote Team Culture At Quantum, equal opportunity, inclusivity and diversity are celebrated. This means they treat people fairly, regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, pregnancy and maternity, marital status, race, religion, or sexual orientation. Contract type: permanent employment Number of positions available: 1 Start Date: ASAP Work location: UK About Turing Talent Programme Founded by people from Google, Meta, Microsoft and McKinsey, Turing Talent is revolutionizing what a tech career looks like. Don’t just get a job! Get a learning journey. We pair jobs with a holistic leadership program specifically for tech professionals to accelerate your career and personal development.﻿ https://www.turingtalent.org/leadershipprogram

User Engagement Manager– (Fintech/Crypto)  Our client is Singapore's fast growing Fintech company managing an exchange trading platform.  Top 5 market leader in the industry across the world, with large clientele in the North America and Europe market.  Business has direction of expanding into the greater market in Asia region and is hiring massively in Singapore  Responsibilities Responsible for improving customer engagement and retention Identify customer behavior and map customer journey Conduct competitive analysis Design new functions and workflow to improve customer experience Lead product/function design, execution, and evaluation Requirements At least 2 years of relevant experience Experience in e-commerce, fintech, or management consulting industries required Strong in data analytics You may WhatsApp your resume to to wa.me/6583890377 or send your resume to ethel@alignrecruitment.com.sg for more information.  Regret to inform you that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by our consultants.  Align Recruitment Pte Ltd (20C0253)  Ethel Tan Seok Khoon (Reg No. R2096281)

Who We Are  You'll be joining the 6th largest IT Service Provider, present in more than 50 countries. From our roots in Japan, NTT DATA's mission is to facilitate business change and technology transformation across many industries for a better future for our business, people and community. Some of the projects we have supported include the digitising of The Open golf tournament and applying Formula 1 technology to support medical staff at University Hospitals Leicester.  Everything we do is underpinned by our core values of 'Clients First', 'Teamwork' and 'Foresight' and we achieve these by putting people first.  We support and celebrate our differences and preferences, these are what makes us unique. Some of our initiatives, collectively known as “DO Diversity”, aim to create a space for us to learn and get involved in building a truly diverse environment. Our Culture & Ethnicity Network gives our colleagues a platform to share their various backgrounds; Our NINGEN programme allows the new generation of NTT DATA employees around the world to connect and shape the future of our organisation and the “City Gives Back” allows us to support our local community that has been affected by the COVID-19 pandemic...and much more!  What You'll Be Doing  As a Network Infrastructure Designer, you will be integral to the delivery of many client projects, working with Tier 1 global telecommunication organisations.  You will have responsibility for gathering requirements from stakeholders, assessing business impacts from proposed network changes, and creating/tailoring designs accordingly.  What You'll Need  Ideally, you'll have experience with some of the following: Knowledge of the telecommunications business and experience of designing Data Centre and Enterprise networks Developing and aligning to Enterprise network strategies Experience of translating business requirements into detailed DC and network requirements Familiarity with all parts of the project lifecycle from project scoping to delivery and implementation Communicating technical issues and solutions on different (management) levels Aligning and reviewing the detailed design(s) in cooperation with suppliers on behalf of our clients Experience presenting/defending changes in CAB meetings We Expect Knowldge/experience Of Some Of The Following Areas An understanding of infrastructure and the impact of network changes Eperience in HLD and LLDs Networks Cisco OR Juniper expertise (certifications such as CCDP & CCNP R&S/SP/DC a bonus) Ideally a telco/service provider background Firewalls (you may have experience incorporating ASAs, Fortigates or CheckPoint into your designs, for example) Loadbalancing (F5 or Citrix Netscaler knowledge/experience) Knowledge of public and private cloud (AWS/Azure, VPCs, network connectivity) ...and finally:  Our team believes in hard work. We celebrate each other's success and are always honest with each other to ensure we grow together. We aim to build a strong professional community where each individual can mentor others and be mentored, and can grow professionally through training and support to reach their career goals. Our focus on clients, teamwork and foresight forms our DNA and we are looking for someone who shares and embodies these core values, leading by example.  To support your hard work and dedication, we will offer you the following: Flexibility to work remotely, dependent on the role 25 days of holidays, with the possibility to buy or sell 5 days within your first month A MacBook or laptop The opportunity, as we grow, to experiment within new industries and technologies in both Private and Public Sectors, including Insurance, Automotive, Financial, Government and more. An online training platform with 3000+ courses, accessible from everywhere, to sharpen your skills Support for training and upskilling Industry leading employer pension contributions …And much more!

Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen (Senior) Data Engineer (m/w/d) mit Fokus auf dem Bereich Search.  Aufgaben: Implement data pipelines for stream and batch processing that feed our search indexes and build our machine learning models Design and implement query rewriting functions and ranking algorithms that improve the quality of our search results Enable a measurable search performance by implementing A/B testing and by tracking of key metrics Implement measures to improve reliability and performance of the search infrastructure Work closely with data scientists, infrastructure engineers, product owners and other stakeholders to deliver a personalized search experience  Anforderung: B.Sc., M.Sc. or Ph.D. in computer science or a related field Experience working as a Data Engineer or Software Engineer Solid skills in programming with Python or Java/Scala Ability to write efficient, well-tested code with a keen eye on scalability and maintainability Hands-on experience with Elasticsearch, Lucene or Solr Experience developing scalable data pipelines with Spark, Beam or related technologies is a plus You enjoy working in an agile team, like to get involved, think "out of the box" and are keen to tackle new topics Good English skills complete your profile  Sehen Sie in der Position des (Senior) Data Engineer (m/w/d) eine spannende neue Herausforderung? desc: 职位来源于智联招聘。  The Global Mobility Specialist (GMS) will support and work directly for one or more Global Mobility Consultant (GMC) to provide a professional global mobility (GM) service for international transferee, short term and long term deployed international assignee and cross border assignee between the mainland China, Hong Kong and Macau. The main roles and responsibilities are: Act as the Subject Matter Expert (SME) to answer enquiries and give advice on visa, benefit, tax, housing, living expense, operation process and compliance etc. Identify issues for solutions and support improvement of GM process Partner with Service Delivery Centre (SDC) and assist location team GM consultant on mobility issues from relocation to repatriation to ensure daily operation, tax reporting smoothly & timely and accurate working with payroll/Finance as well as other needed departments Monitor internal and external vendors’ services in the region and escalate issues and propose solution to Operations manager Ensure GM data accuracy, internal database/shared drive updated, billing/costs accuracy and daily operations compliance in the region Provide backup coverage to GMC during vacation and other absences as appropriate Assist GM Operations Senior Manager on legal documents update in response to GM and/or local policy update Coordinate GM expense approval and billings Participate in global or local initiatives as required 以担保或任何理由索要财物，扣押证照，均涉嫌违法。
